title: Senior Category Sourcing Manager, Networking OEM
description:
DESCRIPTION


AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.  

  

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.  

  

The Networking team is looking for a results\-oriented individual to own technical sourcing activities for OEM networking hardware and software. This individual will own strategy and relationship development with multiple Networking OEM partners who supply switches, routers, optics, firewalls, and other critical networking infrastructure for AWS. This individual will partner closely with multiple network engineering teams to define the OEM hardware and software roadmap for the AWS network will create sourcing strategies to enable favorable material availability, cost, and support terms. Our Category Sourcing Managers are experts in their industries and drive the explosive growth of AWS by enabling disruptive technologies through responsible and strategic sourcing.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Develop OEM networking hardware and software sourcing strategies to deliver against business and engineering objectives and achieve sustainable relationships with strategic suppliers
* Partner closely with the network engineering teams to identify and strategize about hardware and feature set needs to drive a multi\-year technology strategy
* Analyze industry trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base opportunities to minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, optimize cost, and utilize industry developments that benefit Amazon
* Influence suppliers' manufacturing processes, technology decisions, and policies in ways that are mutually beneficial and sustainable for both organizations by leveraging the growth of Amazon's spend.

\- Negotiate and implement supplier agreements/contracts by working with cross\-functional business partners and suppliers to reach agreement on contract terms and conditions. \- Analyze and determine cost reduction opportunities by leveraging volumes, optimizing the supplier base and reducing total cost of ownership.
  

* Lead sourcing engagements and competitive bidding (RFI, RFQ, and RFP).
* Track internal metrics for executing projects and sourcing plans.
* Make optimal trade\-offs between schedule, resources, and scope, and apply advanced technical and business knowledge to address major risks, challenges, and obstacles.
* Help develop long\-term department strategies and significantly influence the cross\-company project development and delivery processes and standards.
* Be a subject matter expert for the customers, technologies, and markets in which you engage
* Keys to success in this role include sound judgment and excellent written/verbal communication skills. The candidate should be able to extract insights from data and be able to communicate clearly appropriate triggers and actions.

  

A day in the life  

You will be working closely with several business partners to manage the Networking OEM category on a day to day basis. This will include interactions with hardware development teams, network design and deployment engineering teams, rack integration, finance, legal, and others. You will also manage working and executive level supplier relationships with multiple Networking OEMs as well as rack integration partners. You will be heavily focused on roadmap planning and execution against a technology migration strategy. You will work with closely with two individuals from your immediate core category team (GSM and PLM) to drive and execute a well\-rounded category strategy (GCM \= You, GSM \= Global Supply Manager, PLM \= Product Lifecycle Manager). You will leverage your expertise to build supplier relationships and architect agreements to support AWS' growing network. You will make responsible sourcing decisions that consider customer security, time to market, technology benefit, quality and cost.  

  

About the team  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship and Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.  

  

A Little About the Team  

The Networking team is made up of global category managers (GCM), global supply managers (GSM), and product lifecycle managers (PLM) who manage the broad base of networking suppliers and internal amazon initiatives that help build the AWS cloud. We drive supply continuity, cost optimization, and technology introduction for networking hardware. We are located throughout multiple regional hubs in the united states and work with suppliers and business partners globally. We are a mix of industry experts and those aspiring to grow our industry expertise. We all bring something valuable to the table from our unique backgrounds; we highlight and celebrate our diverse backgrounds and leverage them to our collective benefit as a team.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 6\+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
* 6\+ years of professional or military experience
* Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, Business, Supply Chain, Quantitative, Technical or quantitative field
* 6\+ years of experience working with engineering teams to develop technology roadmaps and supporting sourcing strategies
* 6\+ years of experience working with executive business partners both internally and externally to drive alignment to strategies

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* MBA or advanced degree
* Background in OEM hardware and software procurement
* Experience in the Enterprise Networking, Hyperscale Networking, Cloud Computing/Storage or other IT Infrastructure industries
* Background in semiconductor industry with working knowledge of supply dependencies
* Experience working at, for, or with Hyperscale cloud provider
* Strong understanding of off\-the\-shelf and custom electronics equipment sourcing
* Must be able to present complex technology and business objectives in concise and understandable manner
* Must have backbone to push back on decisions that do not align with business objectives and propose alternate solutions

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

title: Product Marketing Manager, NA Sales & Marketing
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Devices—the team behind the best\-selling Amazon Echo, Fire TV, Kindle E\-Reader, Fire Tablet, Ring and Blink product lines—is seeking a high\-performing, innovative, experiences, results\-oriented and customer\-obsessed, Senior Product Marketing Manager.  

  

In this role, you will help gift\-givers and bargain hunters find the Amazon Devices they're looking for, develop experiments to determine our promotional strategy and experiences, and lead the biggest events we have, such as Prime Day, Black Friday, Cyber Monday and more for customers.  

  

You will leverage excellent cross\-functional project management skills, a detailed eye for data to develop, launch, test, and report on market\-leading awareness, education, and conversion\-oriented programs touching all areas of the business.  

You will be comfortable in a variety of settings, from presenting marketing plans to leadership as well as executing against those plans. The ability to manage multiple milestones and shifting requirements in a fluid, fast\-moving environment—while keeping stakeholders updated on your progress—is critical to success in this position.  

  

The ideal candidate must be able to think strategically, look at the business analytically, and implement flawlessly. They will have deep experience in consumer product marketing, merchandising and testing, demonstrated ability to drive website optimization and conversion in both mobile and online channels, and a passion for diving into data to uncover actionable insights. They will be equally comfortable generating innovative ideas for growth as well as ensuring tactical level details are executed. The ideal candidate will collaborate and inspire a positive, high\-energy, results\-oriented culture, creating a measurable impact across Amazon and the wider industry landscape.  

  

The position is based in Seattle, covering the North America region.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Author and present documents to leadership on overarching marketing strategy inclusive of multiple traffic channels for the biggest promotional events for Amazon Devices sales
* Collaborate with multiple cross\-company stakeholders/partners to align goals and partner on high sales velocity events
* Deliver comprehensive project management plans across multiple\-stakeholders and identify the critical path for flawless execution to deliver goals
* Dive deep in the metrics and analyze lessons learned from events to form hypotheses for further evaluation and process improvement opportunities
* Devise tests and analyze results to optimize future events and improve customer shopping experiences
* Manage prioritization and trade\-offs among customer experience, performance and operational support load.
* Create buy\-in for customer experiences and goals both internally and across key partners.
* Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the team’s ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals.

  

About the team  

This team is one of the fastest growing marketing teams in Amazon Devices and is chartered to launch products and improve the customer experience while increasing Amazon Device sales and engagement. We refuse to accept constraints, internal or external, and have strong bias for action and ownership.  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* 4\+ years of developing and managing marketing or channel programs experience
* Experience managing teams
* Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
* Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
* Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional marketing programs
* Experience in online marketing channels such as social media marketing, display advertising, and search engine marketing

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Knowledge of HTML, SQL, Excel
* Experience with Tableau, SQL, or basic data\-mining

title: Sr Manager : Cost to Serve, RBS Cost to Serve
description:
DESCRIPTION

* Establish a comprehensive cost\-to\-serve strategy for WW Amazon Stores.
* Program\-manage or directly lead multiple cost efficiency and operational excellence initiatives end\-to\-end. Scope projects, define clear goals and success metrics, and oversee execution on initiatives that reduce costs and improve customer experience during events
* Dive deep into data to uncover root causes of inefficiencies and quantify improvement opportunities. Develop models and dashboards (in partnership with Data Science/Analytics) to measure cost\-to\-serve metrics and track the impact of initiatives. Use a data\-driven approach to prioritize projects and validate savings achieved
* Establish mechanisms (cadence of audits, metrics reviews, and best practice sharing) to widen a continuous improvement mindset. Input on team charters to encourage cost\-conscious thinking and operational excellence. As savings are realized, identify new opportunities and scale successful initiatives market places.

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Own end\-to\-end program governance of the end to end WW Cost to Serve charter, driving strategy, execution, and scaling of initiatives focused on inventory adjustments, theft attribution, receive accuracy, dwelling inventory and other supply chain losses.
* Dive deep into all P\&L\-level metrics to identify key volume drivers, define RCA structures, and influence finance\-aligned savings attribution models.
* Lead cross\-functional collaboration across Ops, Finance, Tech and Product to ensure aligned Strategy, Execution on initiatives.
* Design and scale program mechanisms including the dashboards, reporting rhythms, site\-level deep dives, and shrink attribution SOPs, ensuring consistency across geographies and fulfillment models.
* Support vendor\- and ASIN\-level shrink control for high\-profile brands, by driving catalogue fixes, packaging improvements, and reconciliation frameworks for transshipment and serial scan defects.
* Drive global Cost to Serve program expansion into Canada, EU9, JP, and MENA by tailoring core mechanisms to local process maturity, collaborating with regional stakeholders, and enabling centralized governance at scale.
* Create structured documentation and reviews including strategic one\-pagers, SOPs, investment cases, and MBR/QBR narratives reviewed by VP, S\-Team leadership, influencing prioritization and roadmap alignment.
* Operate in zero\-to\-one spaces with high ambiguity, identifying systemic gaps, unifying siloed efforts, and building durable mechanisms that reduce cost to serve, increase visibility, and unlock long\-term cost\-to\-serve improvements.

  

About the team  

Diverse Perspectives:  

We believe that diverse perspectives drive innovation. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Whether you’re new to the field, have a non\-traditional background, or have gained expertise in different ways, we value the unique insights you can bring.  

  

Commitment to Balance:  

We recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work\-life balance. We foster an environment where flexibility is not just an option but a priority, ensuring you have the support you need to thrive both at work and at home. When we’re at our best in all areas of life, we’re unstoppable.  

  

Inclusive Culture:  

Learning and curiosity are at the heart of our culture. We celebrate what makes us different and support one another through employee\-led groups and ongoing initiatives that champion diversity and inclusion. Our events and learning programs provide a platform for every voice to be heard and valued.  

  

Opportunities for Growth:  

As a team dedicated to continuous improvement, we believe in setting ambitious goals and providing the tools to achieve them. You’ll have access to a wealth of mentorship, knowledge\-sharing, and career development resources to help you advance your skills and achieve your professional aspirations.  

  

Our team is composed of skilled problem solvers who thrive on tackling cross\-functional challenges. We are dedicated to meeting the needs of our internal stakeholders with a solutions\-oriented approach, always striving for the best possible outcome in everything we do.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 7\+ years of team management experience
* 5\+ years of working cross functionally with tech and non\-tech teams experience
* 5\+ years of program or project management experience
* 5\+ years of delivering cross functional projects experience
* Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
* Experience analyzing P\&L cost lines (e.g., inventory defects, shrink, operational costs) and partnering with finance teams to drive cost attribution and track savings impact

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 2\+ years of driving process improvements experience
* Master's degree, or MBA in business, operations, human resources, adult education, organizational development, instructional design or related field

title: Senior Antenna Engineer, Kuiper Antennas and CT
description:
DESCRIPTION


Project Kuiper is Amazon's effort to launch a group of Low Earth Orbit satellites to provide fast, affordable broadband to communities globally. Our Customer Terminal (CT) antenna team is creating leading phased array technologies to link users to the Kuiper satellite network from almost anywhere on Earth.  

  

We are looking for an exceptional engineer to join our Customer Terminal antenna team. This person will advance phased array antennas, drive innovation in RF, antenna, custom ASIC, and communication systems. This role offers a unique chance to contribute to the development of advanced phased arrays and be part of something exceptional.  

  

  

  

Key job responsibilities  

In this role, you will be responsible for the development and integration of advanced phased array system into products, including:  

* Work with a cross\-functional team, define antenna requirements.
* Ensure seamless integration between custom ASICs and antenna systems for optimal RF performance.
* Define antenna concepts and requirements during product definition.
* Develop tools for antenna performance analysis in larger systems.
* Champion engineering excellence and innovation, setting a high bar for technical depth, quality, and delivery.
* Build a strong culture of ownership, where engineers are empowered to innovate and challenge assumptions.
* Build and test active phased array prototypes and front\-end circuits.
* Influence and define system\-level requirements in collaboration with the ASIC, software, systems, and product teams.
* Work with the worlds most forward thinking and innovative phased array engineers.

  

Export Control Requirement:  

Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.  

  

A day in the life  

As a Senior Antenna Engineer, you will engage with an experienced cross\-disciplinary team to conceive and design innovative phased array antennas. You will work closely with Project Kuiper’s various sub\-teams and engage third party suppliers in order to drive key aspects of product definition, design, optimization, implementation and test.
  

  

About the team  

The Kuiper Antennas and CT team is developing the next generation of high\-performance, low\-cost antennas to bring global internet access to the most remote areas on Earth. The team is composed of world\-class experts in phased array design, RF systems, hardware and software development, and custom ASICs. We work in a collaborative, fast\-paced, and technically challenging environment, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible every day.  

  

In this role you'll work on one of the most ambitious and technically advanced antenna teams in the world, with the mission to deliver a transformational product to global customers.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* BS degree in EE with RF and antenna coursework or research, or equivalent experience
* 7\+ years of experience of research and/or development in antenna design
* 3\+ years of experience in programming in Matlab, Python or C\+\+
* Experience with one of the mainstream antenna simulation tools (CST, HFSS, FEKO, …)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


\- MSc or PhD in EE with RF\- or antenna\-related thesis research  

* Strong foundations in antennas: Impedance matching, theoretical and practical limitations of antennas
* Strong foundation in mathematics and physics
* Experience in development of computational tools
* 3\+ year of design experience RF building blocks such as filters, hybrids, combiners
* Experience with active RF circuits and front\-end design
* Experience in phased array development
* Hands\-on experience with phased array calibration, characterization, and over\-the\-air validation.
* Experience with both planar and volumetric phased arrays, analog/digital beamforming, and unique lattice architectures.

title: Principal Applied Scientist - Generative AI, Trust and Store Integrity Science
description:
DESCRIPTION


As we strive to be Earth's most customer\-centric company, Amazon has reinvented how hundreds of millions of people shop online – providing customers with the opportunity to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy and providing millions of sellers with a platform for growing successful businesses. We are seeking an exceptional Principal Applied Scientist to lead the development and implementation of advanced AI solutions that will transform how we prevent bad actors from operating in our store and enable Selling Partners to start and grow their business without fear of disruption, so that customers and Selling Partners across the globe trust us and have confidence in the integrity of Amazon’s store.
  

  

This role will focus on leveraging large language models and other generative AI technologies to enhance decision\-making processes, automate complex risk assessment tasks, and improve operational efficiency in selling partner risk management.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Lead the research, design, and implementation of innovative AI solutions for selling partner risk assessment and management
* Drive the technical vision for applying AI to transform workforce operations in Trust and Store Integrity organization
* Develop novel approaches to automate and enhance risk analysis processes using state\-of\-the\-art language models
* Partner with business stakeholders to identify high\-impact opportunities for AI\-driven transformation
* Mentor and guide junior scientists while fostering a culture of innovation
* Design and implement evaluation frameworks to measure the impact of AI solutions
* Ensure responsible AI development with focus on fairness, transparency, and ethical considerations

  

About the team  

Trust and Store Integrity Science is a new org established in 2024\. We are missioned to leverage the fast evolving AI advancements to transform how we prevent bad actors in our stores, across science, engineering, product and program management, and operations.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field, or equivalent experience
* 10\+ years of experience in applied machine learning and AI
* Deep expertise in natural language processing and generative AI technologies
* Strong track record of delivering ML solutions at scale
* Experience with large language models and their enterprise applications

• Excellence in Python and modern ML frameworks • Strong publication record in top\-tier conferences/journals
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Preferred Qualifications:
  

• Experience in risk management or fraud detection • Knowledge of e\-commerce marketplace dynamics • Track record of leading large\-scale AI transformation projects
  

* Experience with AWS AI/ML services
* Strong business acumen and ability to translate technical solutions to business impact

title: Software Development Engineer, Worldwide Amazon Stores Finance Technology
description:
DESCRIPTION


Our team is responsible for building technical solutions for finance controllership using Big Data, Machine Learning, AWS technologies and Microservices Architecture. We are currently looking for a full stack developer who will work with the team to build technical APIs and web based solution to allow one\-click analysis over trillions of events impacting multi\-billion dollar decisions.  

  

Successful candidates will work as part of a team to expand current solutions by working with a broad cross\-section of the Amazon organization and spanning wide range of technologies. This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to have a large impact in how Amazon optimizes our cost structure and understands implications of new business initiatives in the most efficient and self\-service way.  

  

As a Full Stack Software Development Engineer, you will help solve a variety of technical challenges and build highly scalable solutions to solve unique problems for World Wide business teams. You will help solve our BigData problems making use of AWS services, design enterprise scaled systems, develop and deploy highly scalable and reliable distributed services. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day. You'll work in degree of ambiguity that’s higher than most projects and solve problems that, haven’t been solved at scale before. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll learn a ton, have fun and make a huge impact.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions for financial control systems
* Lead technical design reviews and provide architectural guidance for complex projects
* Mentor junior engineers and contribute to team's technical excellence
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver optimal solutions
* Ensure high availability and reliability of financial systems
* Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems
* Drive best practices in code quality, testing, and deployment

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
* 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
* Experience programming with at least one software programming language

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Product Marketing Manager, Amazon Business
description:
DESCRIPTION


Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $35 billion global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space, developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination, and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.  

  

This role is part of the Amazon Business WW Marketing team and our vision is to establish Amazon Business as the most recognized B2B brand. In this role, you will lead the strategy and production of engaging onsite experiences, and champion event production across cross\-functional teams. This includes merchandising events and seasonal promotions globally on Amazon Business. This role will need to communicate regularly with senior leadership and be responsible for driving top\-level business goals.  

  

To be successful in this role, this individual will work seamlessly with senior stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Category, Selection, Pricing, and Tech across geographic regions to optimize through scale and continuous experimentation. We are looking for an individual with broad experience in online merchandising, digital marketing, and product marketing. This role requires skills in strategic thinking, relationship building, and problem solving, as well as a willingness to be hands\-on with execution.
  

  

The ideal candidate has a track record of success in delivering results at scale and working cross\-functionally across multiple teams and countries. The individual will thrive in a fast\-paced, high\-pressure entrepreneurial environment. If you’re looking to join a dynamic, growing team in a high\-impact role, this is a great fit for you.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Own WW strategy and production of onsite events and seasonal promotions (e.g., Back to School, Black Friday) on Amazon Business
* Deliver multi\-channel marketing campaigns and engaging onsite experiences for B2B customers
* Develop detailed campaign project plans, creative briefs, and digital strategies, including campaign goals, messaging, calls to action, segmentation strategy, marketing distribution channels, and campaign schedule
* Apply key insights into business actions and push for new ways to achieve objectives at scale
* Define business metrics, measurement plan, and testing plan for site\-event events
* Work at both the strategic and tactical level to champion bold, creative ideas
* Test and refine new marketing approaches and channels to reach and engage key audiences
* Create and maintain scalable, repeatable methods of measurement and performance tracking for campaigns
* Manage multiple projects gracefully and balancing contending priorities in a rapidly changing environment

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 2\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
* Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
* Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional programs or marketing campaigns from concept to completion
* Experience managing and measuring marketing performance in various channels

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 4\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience managing external partners to develop marketing programs
* Experience presenting ideas to various levels of an organization to gain support for initiatives

title: Sr. Manager, Finance Operations Accounting, Payroll
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon seeks an experienced Senior Manager to be the Global Functional Leader for Payroll on the Finance Operations Accounting \& Analysis (FOAA) team. Finance Operations enables and accelerates Amazon’s growth by improving the vendor and seller experience through automation and innovative process improvements that simplify doing business with Amazon and that enable lower prices and greater selection for our customers. This position is the key partner for Global Payroll senior leadership and will partner with Global Operations and Accounting teams to identify areas of controllership risk, compliance risk, and related financial accounting impact. The ideal candidate is a highly proactive self\-starter with a strong operational and accounting background, problem solving skills and attention to detail who will take ownership and drive positive change including evaluating and streamlining existing operational and accounting processes, controls and metrics. This role has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  

  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  

* Set goals for the FOAA Payroll function globally
* Prioritize automation projects within FOAA Payroll to drive FOAA baseline savings goals
* Drive operational excellence by identifying business process re\-engineering opportunities and partnering with projects team to provide accounting requirements that maintain highest level of controllership
* Drive global reporting format standardization and set SLA’s
* Ensure all Central Accounting Deliverables met within SLA; analyzing account activity; validating account balances are materially correct; explaining business drivers for account balance fluctuations
* Influencing business decisions with effective verbal and written communication, data driven analysis and presentation of alternatives
* Facilitate financial review meetings with FinOps leadership, including design and review of internal financial reports
* Raise the bar on hiring, developing, and retaining the best talent to continue building our world class team of finance professionals

  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or related field
* 12\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
* 10\+ years of positions that require analysis and reporting financial results experience
* 8\+ years of Accounts Receivable or Account Payable experience
* 7\+ years of directly managing and leading a team of 10\+ members experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 5\+ years of hiring, leading and developing teams experience
* 8\+ years of participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results experience
* 8\+ years of identifying incomplete or inaccurate data, identifying the root cause and creating/implementing an escalation plan experience
* 8\+ years of mentoring junior finance and/or business team members experience
* 5\+ years of working with senior staff (e.g. c\-suite) experience
* MBA, or CPA

title: Manager, Analytics, DARE, Amazon Prime Video Catalog Data, Analytics, Reserch and Excellence
description:
DESCRIPTION


Prime Video offers customers a vast collection of movies, series, and sports—all available to watch on hundreds of compatible devices. U.S. Prime members can also subscribe to 100\+ channels including Max, discovery\+, Paramount\+ with SHOWTIME, BET\+, MGM\+, ViX\+, PBS KIDS, NBA League Pass, MLB.TV, and STARZ with no extra apps to download, and no cable required. Prime Video is just one of the savings, convenience, and entertainment benefits included in a Prime membership. More than 200 million Prime members in 25 countries around the world enjoy access to Amazon’s enormous selection, exceptional value, and fast delivery.  

  

  

  

We are seeking an experienced and innovative Manager of Business Intelligence Engineering to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will collaborate with internal stakeholders across various departments, including Product, Technology, Science, UX, and Operations, at all levels of our organization. As a key member of our team, you will develop and support data visualization, metrics reporting, analytics, and research initiatives that provide our stakeholders and customers with crucial insights into our business, enabling informed decision\-making.  

  

The ideal candidate will thrive in our fast\-paced, global environment, embracing the challenges and rewards of working in a rapidly growing organization. You should be an excellent communicator with extensive knowledge of data visualization, business intelligence, and business analysis. Your expertise will be instrumental in leading and mentoring a team of business analysts and business intelligence engineers, fostering their professional growth and development.  

  

If you're comfortable navigating a fast\-moving organization, passionate about data\-driven insights, and excited about the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business and team members' careers, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join us in shaping the future of our organization through the power of business intelligence and analytics.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

Lead and Develop Teams  

  

* Build and mentor a high\-performing team of Business Intelligence Engineers and Business/Data Analysts
* Foster a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement

  

Strategic Partnership and Stakeholder Management  

  

* Collaborate with leadership across divisions to understand data requirements and recommend appropriate ML/Business intelligence solutions
* Work closely with Data Engineering teams to define and structure data elements that enhance analytical capabilities
* Partner with data engineering, machine learning, and software development teams to optimize data capture and storage

  

Technical Leadership and Innovation  

  

* Design and implement user\-friendly data visualization platforms enabling business teams to access and analyze large datasets
* Develop and maintain performance metrics, reports, dashboards, and analytics that drive key business decisions
* Establish standardized data reporting protocols across all customer groups
* Champion best practices in reporting and analysis, ensuring data integrity, robust testing, and thorough documentation

  

Business Impact and Communication  

  

* Create and implement new metrics and studies to analyze customer behavior and improve performance
* Deliver clear written and verbal presentations of insights and recommendations to diverse audiences with varying technical backgrounds
* Demonstrate ability to work effectively within diverse, cross\-functional teams
  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 7\+ years of business intelligence and analytics experience
* 5\+ years of delivering results managing a business intelligence or analytics team, including employee development and performance management experience
* Experience with SQL
* Experience with ETL
* Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
* Experience with R, Python, Weka, SAS, Matlab or other statistical/machine learning software

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 8\+ years of working with very large data warehousing environment experience
* 10\+ years of data warehouse technical architectures, data modeling, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments, data structures and hands\-on SQL coding experience
* Experience leading and influencing the BI strategy of your team or organization

title: Senior Email Marketing Manager, Amazon Payment Products
description:
DESCRIPTION


Interested in leading the Email Marketing strategy for Amazon Credit Cards? The North America Payment Products Marketing team is looking for a customer obsessed email marketing expert who will define and lead the email marketing strategy to drive engagement, usage and awareness of key benefits and product features for existing cardmembers. You will build and scale the email marketing strategy for our credit card portfolio, defining requirements for design, implementation and launch of strategic email campaigns. You will create the frameworks to scale campaign analysis, synthesize learning, make decisions and prioritize our email marketing roadmap using a data\-driven approach. You will partner with cross functional teams in Product, Design, Tech, Data Science, Finance and Legal to deliver a comprehensive roadmap for email marketing initiatives and enforce a high bar for email communications to improve customer experience. This role requires deep understanding of customer needs, business trends, product features, and the ability to deliver results while balancing conflicting priorities.  

  

The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast\-paced environment with strategic thinking and flawless execution. You are energized by the dynamic nature of our business and can work through ambiguity to manage multiple projects at once.  

  

  

  

Key job responsibilities  

Develop email marketing strategy for Amazon credit cards including targeting and messaging strategy  

Execute tests, analyze results, and recommend improvements in performance  

Identify opportunities for testing, personalizing, launching new lifecycle campaigns to drive business performance  

Partner with design team to implement bar\-raising email experiences that align with brand guidelines  

Drive email marketing operation improvements with automation, standardization and collaboration with stakeholders.  

  

About the team  

We are a global team of product managers, marketers, researchers, and designers that serve tens of millions of customers worldwide through a portfolio of products. Our goals are to delight them with best\-in\-class rewards, easy access to credit, and the simplicity to sell or buy cross\-border on Amazon in their local currency. We have a think\-big culture where every voice is heard and are passionate about continuous learning, career development, and collaboration.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 6\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
* Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional marketing programs
* Experience owning and driving email marketing strategy
* Experience managing and measuring marketing performance in various channels

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience with customer segmentation, profiling, and targeting
* Experience managing external partners to develop marketing programs

title: Sr Product Mgr, New Business Models, Flex WW Expansion
description:
DESCRIPTION


Do you thrive on driving innovation and building entirely new products from the ground up? Are you looking for a high\-impact, global role where you can use your product management expertise to transform a critical part of Amazon's business? The Global Amazon Flex organization is seeking an exceptional Senior Product Manager to lead a strategic initiative reshaping our global last mile delivery operations.  

  

In this role, you will own the product strategy and roadmap for building growth opportunities for Independent Contractors and Small Businesses, while catering to the speed, flexibility and volatility needs of Amazon’s operations. You will develop PRFAQs and business plans that deliver great experiences for Delivery Partners and solve our business needs.  

  

You will be responsible for identifying customer pain points and optimization opportunities through data analysis to inform the product vision and roadmap. Leveraging your strong problem\-solving and creative thinking skills, you will lead end\-to\-end product development, include evaluating the current landscape, developing pricing structures, operational approach, financial models, and marketing plans. You will partner with our Amazon Flex technology teams and the broader Last Mile org to develop the product roadmap, and will partner with local teams to operationally execute on new business models. You will also be called upon to communicate product strategies and recommendations effectively to senior leadership, driving critical business decisions in a fast\-paced, ambiguous, environment.  

  

This is a truly global role, with the chance to expand and transform Amazon's last mile delivery operations around the world. If you're looking to take your product management career to new heights, this position provides an exceptional platform to expand your expertise and make a significant impact on our global logistics network.  

  

The ideal candidate will have 5\+ years of product management experience, ideally in logistics, supply chain, or a related field. You should thrive in a highly analytical, customer\-centric environment and possess excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities. A background in technology innovation, process optimization or logistics is a plus. Our organization is based in the US, but we drive global operations across 5 continents. Domestic and international travel will be required 10\-20% of the time.  

  

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on Amazon's global logistics network. You will have the chance to drive innovation that scales across our worldwide operations and shapes the future of how we fulfill customer orders. If you're looking to take your product management career to new heights, we'd love to hear from you.  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 5\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
* Experience with end to end product delivery
* Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
* Experience as a product manager or owner
* Experience owning technology products

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights
* Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders

title: Tax Program Manager, Tax Transformation, Tax Integration
description:
DESCRIPTION


Elevate Tax Operations through Strategic Innovation, Transformation and Technological Integration  

  

We are seeking a dynamic Tax Process Transformation Specialist to be instrumental in how we approach tax reporting and compliance. In this role, you'll collaborate with tax, finance, technology, and strategic teams to gather requirements, design and implement solutions that streamline complex tax processes and drive organizational efficiency.
  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Design and implement comprehensive process improvement strategies for tax reporting and compliance.
* Own, develop and manage multi\-dimensional project plans, often more than one at a time.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to align project objectives and drive technological integration.
* Create detailed documentation of requirements, technical solutions, controls, use cases, and impact.
* Identify and mitigate potential risks to project scope and timeline.

  

A day in the life  

Your day will be a blend of program management, cross\-functional collaboration, and innovative problem\-solving. You'll engage with subject matter experts, technology teams, and stakeholders to identify process improvement opportunities, develop comprehensive project plans, and implement transformative solutions that scale with our business growth.  

  

About the team  

We are a collaborative and forward\-thinking group dedicated to reimagining tax operations. Our team is committed to leveraging technology and strategic insights to create more efficient, accurate, and scalable tax reporting processes. We value innovative thinking, continuous learning, and the ability to drive meaningful change.

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office products and applications at an advanced level

title: Program Manager, Capacity Planning, NA FLEX
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon is looking for a Program Manager with a strong delivery record and proven project management experience to own strategic, tactical, cross\-functional and technology projects and programs across multiple verticals. This role requires scoping and creating project plans, developing processes, coordinating and driving execution, and communicating to senior management on status, risks and process/product changes. Cross\-team coordination, project management and executive presentation skills are essential. The ideal candidate will leverage extensive project management experience, combined with deep analytical capabilities and a keen sense of innovation, to lead complex projects from conception to completion.  

  

We are seeking a Program Manager who will be an integral part in driving changes across Amazon’s operations and supporting top\-down and bottom\-up changes across our logistic network. In this role, you will be responsible for driving large\-scale end\-to\-end process changes and partnering with multiple internal and external stakeholders to improve performance across multiple operational programs. You will be responsible for briefing senior leaders on portfolio performance across your assigned span of control. You will be responsible for providing expert guidance to operators and managers while managing the successful delivery of projects and goals across multiple organizations.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Manage and oversee various cross\-functional programs, ensuring successful delivery.
* Develop and refine program strategies, effectively leading and motivating teams.
* Set clear objectives for programs, leveraging data analytics to drive improvements and achieve metrics.
* Navigate and resolve ambiguities in business scenarios, applying creative problem\-solving skills.
* Foster collaboration with internal and external partners to optimize resource allocation and project success.
* Evaluate and prioritize projects in conjunction with customer needs and technical team inputs.
* Bridge gaps in team dynamics, processes, and systems, preventing common project pitfalls.
* Identify and mitigate risks, preventing them from escalating into major issues.
* Regularly communicate with senior managers, business leaders, and other stakeholders to support key business initiatives.
* Develop, implement, and oversee KPI reporting for a program portfolio, ensuring clear visibility of milestones and project performance.

  

A day in the life  

A day in this role blends recurring tasks with exciting new project work. Typically, 20\-30% of the week involves regular planning activities, such as updating project timelines and conducting status meetings. The rest is dynamic: collaborating with internal teams like engineering and operations, as well as external partners to drive new initiatives. You'll spend time analyzing data to identify process improvements, preparing executive summaries, and problem\-solving with cross\-functional teams to optimize operations and launch new strategies.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of program or project management experience
* 3\+ years of defining and implementing process improvement initiatives using data and metrics experience
* Knowledge of Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookUps) at an advanced level and SQL
* Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements
* Experience working cross functionally with tech and non\-tech teams
* Bachelor's degree

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of driving end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership experience
* 3\+ years of driving process improvements experience
* Experience in stakeholder management, dealing with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization
* Experience building processes, project management, and schedules

title: Software Development Engineer II, AWS Infrastructure Services
description:
DESCRIPTION


AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
  

  

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
  

  

The AWS Infrastructure group is responsible for procuring, setting up and operating all AWS infrastructure. This includes data center setup, equipment purchase, installation and operation of servers with power and cooling, inventory management and other such decisions. The pricing \& sourcing services team supports AWS supply chain planning \& purchasing. The solutions we develop are scalable to sustain rapid AWS growth, and also flexible to support the evolving AWS supply chain.
  

  

We are looking for Software Development Engineers who want to work on challenging, high impact problems. The services we own support billions of dollars in spend, resulting in us having a huge opportunity to move the needle in a positive direction. The team has a strong group of senior engineering and science talent, so it will be a great place for someone to deliver results, while also learning and progressing their career.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Collaborate with experienced cross\-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring innovative products and services to market.
* Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
* Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
* Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault\-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
* Design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
* Work in an agile environment to deliver high\-quality software.

  

A day in the life  

The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and influence millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company where development cycles are measured in weeks, not years.  

  

About the team  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Diverse Experiences  

Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship and Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
* 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
* Experience programming with at least one software programming language

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Sr. HR Business Partner, Data Center Planning and Delivery
description:
DESCRIPTION


At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer\-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. Using AWS, companies can requisition compute power, storage, and other services – gaining access to a global computing infrastructure that is the backbone of Amazon.com’s multi\-billion dollar retail business. Today, AWS provides a highly reliable, scalable, low\-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers millions of active monthly customers from start\-ups to multi\-national corporations to governments.
  

  

Amazon is looking for an exceptional Sr. HR Business Partner to drive the development and implementation of the HR strategy in support of our Data Center Planning and Delivery business (DCPD). This role requires a progressive, data driven and customer obsessed HRBP who will have responsibility of driving organization effectiveness while implementing impactful and strategic HR programs. DCPD is a compelling business to partner with: they own multiple critical activities globally including the acquisition of power, real estate, colocation contracting, construction execution, the planning and management of build delivery to meet customer demand, the recycling of capacity back into the fleet, strategic portfolio management of the existing sites, and programs across these areas to continually improve AWS’s safety, quality, delivery, sustainability and cost of capacity.  

  

As the Sr. HRBP, you will be responsible for both strategy and execution across the DCPD organization in important business focus areas such as driving organizational health and effectiveness, workforce planning, location strategy and more. You will also closely partner with Talent Acquisition stakeholders on building the right teams, with the right skills, in the right places.
  

  

To be successful in this role, you must understand business priorities and goals and translate them into the highest impact work. You’ll help business leaders look around corners with recommendations based on data that improve organizational effectiveness and builder experience. The ability to facilitate change management for large organizations within a rapid and complex changing work environment, create efficiencies, and make sound judgement in ambiguous situations are critical to the success of this role. Success will also require an aptitude to dive deep and analyze data to develop meaningful insights and conclusions, and to be able to present clearly and with purpose to the relevant audience.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Develop and implement people plans and solutions in order to achieve people initiatives and deliver results for the organization. Ensure these plans align with the larger organization’s priorities.
* Partner with senior leadership to develop the talent strategy that enables the right level and type of growth; building a work environment where employees can thrive and grow.
* Work closely with specialist and central HR teams, as well as matrixed site and geographically aligned HR colleagues to support the global talent strategy. Contribute to the needs of the larger organization while still tailoring activities to the needs of your specific business.
* Function as a consultant and trusted advisor to key leaders and their respective organizations; engage in strategic planning efforts to translate business needs into HR plans.
* Partner with executives on organizational design, communication strategies, workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment and development.
* Review and analyze business metrics including data on retention and employee experience in order to recommend systemic improvements.
* Partner with the business on designing effective Talent Reviews, focused on succession planning, talent development and organizational health priorities.
* Provide compensation support including salary planning, approval of salary actions, promotions and job re\-leveling.
* Create, deploy, and scale programmatic solutions based on current and potential future needs, in the fast paced, high growth business unit. Drive HR process and tool innovation for scale and efficiency.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience
* 7\+ years in an HR generalist leadership role
* Strong judgment and experience coaching leaders.
* Broad experience and specific knowledge of human resource theory, including employee relations, learning, and performance management.
* Excellent written and verbal communication; high quality document preparation, data visualization, and facilitation skills
* Must be able to travel domestically and internationally, as appropriate.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Master’s degree in Human Resources or MBA
* 5\+ years’ experience working as a business partner, and driving organizational change initiatives and developing talent management plans for global organization teams
* Work experience in the tech industry
* Experience in highly matrixed organization
* Experience leading global HR programs and related change management
* Ability to diagnose issues and drive appropriate strategic solutions with self\-initiative
* Ability to refine strategy and gain buy\-in by influencing and partnering with different levels of the organization

title: Sr. Product Manager - Technical (Buy with Prime / Merchant), Buy with Prime and Multi-Channel Fulfillment
description:
DESCRIPTION


We build commerce services to support merchants in growing their off\-Amazon businesses. We're looking for an experienced product manager \- technical to build innovative solutions that enable merchants of all sizes to easily integrate our commerce solutions such as Buy with Prime into their existing front\-end (e.g., Direct\-to\-Customer e\-commerce site) and back\-end (e.g., OMS/ERP) systems.  

  

As a Sr. Product Manager Technical, you will lead product strategy, turning customer insights and feedback into plans that accelerate delivery of the right product for merchants and shoppers. You will work directly with dedicated engineering teams and senior leadership to drive product development for developer\-facing products influencing fundamental technical design decisions, product roadmap, go\-to\-market plans and long\-term strategy.  

  

Our ideal teammate will possess a strong product management background and have experience leading large\-scale technical products. You are naturally curious, data\-driven and entrepreneurial as you take end\-to\-end ownership for your product. You are the kind of leader who anticipates bottlenecks, deftly navigates ambiguity, makes informed trade\-off decisions and skillfully balances the needs of the business versus technical constraints. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills that help you build strong partnerships with colleagues and influence senior leaders. If you enjoy cutting through ambiguity, eliminating complexity and innovating on behalf of customers, come join us!  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Develop and communicate a compelling product vision and strategy.
* Deeply understand the technology and collaborate closely with your engineering partners to support the long term technology strategy for our integration products.
* Understand customer pain points and collaborate with engineering counterparts on the roadmap to address gaps, identify dependencies and clear blockers, balancing impact vs. engineering cost.
* Define the success metrics for features or services to track performance, deep\-dive on issues and uncover trends and patterns.

  

About the team  

Buy with Prime is helping people reimagine the way they shop. Our vision is to enable every entrepreneur in the world to reach every customer in the world through every channel they can imagine. Buy with Prime is a new way to extend Prime shopping benefits—including fast, free shipping, seamless checkout experience, and free returns—to merchants’ own online stores, ultimately increasing selection for Prime members. Buy with Prime is an exciting next step in our mission to help merchants of all sizes grow their business—whether on Amazon or beyond.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree
* Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
* Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
* Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
* Experience managing technical products or online services
* Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
* Experience with developer platforms and developer experience (DX) design

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Master's degree
* 5\+ years of technical product or program management experience
* Experience building API solutions (REST, GraphQL) for developer customers

title: Senior Brand Strategist, Amazon Devices Brand Studio
description:
DESCRIPTION


The Devices and Services Brand Studio is looking for a dynamic, multifaceted brand builder and storyteller to join Amazon as a Senior Brand Strategist. A creative and incisive thinker, this individual will be responsible for crafting and driving alignment on the strategic elements of brand strategy, including brand positioning, brand architecture, creative strategy, and brand identity. This role will steward strategy through the creative processes – from product concept and UX considerations through marketing and engagement campaigns – collaborating across teams to build cohesive storytelling that positively shifts perceptions, influences desired customer behaviors, and grows our brands and businesses. You will have the opportunity to refine and shape established world\-class brands, including Alexa, Echo, Kindle, Fire TV, as well as to define new brands, products, services, and initiatives. You will also define strategies and tactics to connect our brands through strategy and storytelling.
  

  

The Senior Brand Strategist is a prophetic thinker who is deeply engaged with cultural and tech industry trends, and intersects their knowledge and high judgement with customer and business insights. They work closely with teammates and partners across Naming Strategy, Customer Insights, Brand Design, Content Strategy, Creative Program Management, Brand Marketing, Go\-to\-Market, Product Management, UX and Industrial Design, as well as with brand and business stakeholders in other parts of Amazon, and at times with external agencies. This individual thrives in complex and fast\-paced environments and is gifted in arriving at distinctive and compellingly strategies in the face of the most complicated and ambiguous business and customer challenges. The ability to craft an inspiring and well written narrative that influences teams at all levels is critical to success in this role, as is the ability to develop (in partnership with Creative) and deliver compelling presentations. This candidate will also excel at continuous optimization of brand work flows and tools, leveraging AI.  

  

  

  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Drive cultural research and insights (often in partnership with insights teams), presenting findings in compelling ways across organizational levels
* Craft brand architecture strategies
* Lead collaborative workshops with cross\-functional partners to integrate customer insights, cultural trends, and business objectives
* Create and implement brand positioning frameworks that shape product development, marketing, and customer experience
* Author strategic briefs ranging from high\-level brand direction to specific campaign tactics
* Partner with Insights teams to develop brand health metrics, design targeted research studies, and transform findings into actionable innovation strategies
* Collaborate with Content Strategy to develop cohesive brand storytelling across the customer journey
* Champion strategic thinking through knowledge sharing and documentation of brand insights, with frequent authoring of documents and presentations that drive discussion, debate and decision making with Amazon's most senior leadership.
* Publish strategic guidelines, establish scalable best practices, and steward brand strategy alignment with various creative and product making teams
  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience in marketing or marketing research
* Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
* Experience communicating results to senior leadership
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, business or equivalent
* Experience creating and managing complex, cross\-team project plans
* 6\+ years experience defining and executing brand strategies for multiple top global brands.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience with customer segmentation, profiling, and targeting
* Brand strategy experience in consumer electronics, technology, or entertainment industries

title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Migration and Modernization
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers—including the fastest\-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—are using AWS to lower costs, become more agile, and innovate faster.
  

  

Product Marketing is responsible for developing crisp, highly differentiated, and compelling positioning and messaging for AWS and its services. We tell AWS’s most important and interesting stories to educate customers about what is possible when you migrate, modernize and build on AWS.
  

  

This role can sit in one of these USA locations only: Arlington, VA, USA \| Atlanta, GA, USA \| Boston, MA, USA \| East Palo Alto, CA, USA \| New York, NY, USA \| San Francisco, CA, USA \| Seattle, WA, USA.  

  

Relocation offered to these locations only from within the USA only.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

As a Product Marketing Manager for Migration and Modernization on AWS, you will have the opportunity to define the value proposition for migrating to and modernizing with AWS for our customers. You will be responsible for building compelling content aligned to our services portfolio that drives awareness, preference, and adoption of AWS. You will also be responsible for scaling our messaging through key channels including the website, blog, events, campaigns and more. Working with counterparts in engineering and sales, you will help drive the promotion and adoption of new features and services targeted at customers looking to migrate and modernize applications with AWS and our partners.  

  

You will get to work on a growing, high profile business and have a strategic impact on our business planning and growth strategy for migration and modernization with AWS.  

  

Key job responsibilities
  

* Craft \& develop compelling stories, content and tools (e.g. presentations, whitepapers, infographics, webinars, customer success stories, product videos.) that land our migration and modernization on AWS value proposition
* Own content strategy and execution for key communication channels including website, blog, social, on\-network promotion, events, and emails
* Work with engineering teams to distill key functionality and benefits into product marketing messages
* Engage with customer communities to drive AWS advocacy
* Drive successful service launches inclusive of customer benefit messaging and positioning

  

A day in the life  

Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)  

  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving awareness, consideration, adoption, revenue and growth from the largest and fastest growing small\- and mid\-market accounts to enterprise\-level customers including public sector.  

  

About the team  

About AWS  

  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences.
  

  

Mentorship \& Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 7\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional marketing programs
* Experience in cloud computing and/or strategic enterprise workloads
* Proven track record of leading successful product launches
* Experience writing detailed messaging and positioning and strategic plan

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience communicating results to senior leadership
* Experience marketing to enterprise buyers and decision makers
* Strong technical background with demonstrated ability to understand and communicate complex technologies
* Executive presence and strategic thinking with ability to influence decision makers
* Understanding of migration and modernization technologies and business drivers

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company’s reputation.
