title: Sr UX Designer, Core Shopping, Amazon Devices
description:
DESCRIPTION


The Amazon Devices Customer Insights \& UX design team seeks a thoughtful, creative, and passionate Sr UX Designer to be a part of our team as we define how Amazon Devices customers discover, learn about, purchase, and get the most value out of their devices. We are a global organization building platforms and programs to support the sale of and engagement with Amazon Devices including Fire Tablets, Kindle E\-readers, Amazon Echo products, Streaming Media Products, Home Security and Smart Home products, and more. Join our team to help us define, design, and build next\-generation shopping experiences for our customers. You'll be part of a multi\-disciplinary team of designers, researchers, and technologists that can envision, create, and execute ideas from start to end.  

  

As Sr UX Designer, you will own the Online Shopping Experience for Amazon Devices, defining and designing interfaces across platforms (mobile, desktop) for the Amazon Device shopping experience on Amazon.com that scale. You will tackle our most difficult customer problems as they evaluate and consider Amazon Devices and work with a high degree of ambiguity, designing best\-in\-class consumer experiences (user interface designs, interaction models, prototypes, etc.) in a fast\-paced, startup\-like environment. You will work closely with product management, engineering, marketing, research, and company leaders to successfully go from early\-stage concepts to launch, and support new Amazon Device launches as new technology is released to the public. You will act as a “bar raiser” for the work deployed from the User Experience team to external and internal customers and create mechanisms, frameworks, and design systems to maintain a high bar across the User Experience team. You will be an Amazon Devices “ambassador,” driving cross\-organizational collaboration and sharing, and evangelize the UX work our team is doing to drive best practices throughout the company.  

  

You must be responsive, flexible, and able to deal with ambiguity, stakeholder complexity, and the fluidity of emerging technologies within an open and collaborative peer environment. You will visualize experiences in the abstract and drive that vision into solid design deliverables that achieve the customer goals and business requirements.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Collaborate and work cross\-functionally with design, research, product, and engineering teams from design concept to design solution, setting UX guidelines, creating assets, and aiding in bug fixes to ensure bar\-raising quality all the way to market.
* Create the vision for developing, communicating, and implementing the user experience and follow through with the processes and tactics to fulfill the vision.
* Oversee close coordination with product managers to develop a shared vision and lead the process to define the experience and design to deliver on the product’s objectives.
* Use data (metric tests, usability studies, usage data) to identify opportunities and inform decisions.
* Create pattern libraries, templates, and tools for a variety of users on our platform.
* Identify and utilize common patterns for mobile, desktop, and e\-commerce platforms.
* Consider how emerging technologies can unlock new customer experiences and scale business operations.
* Consider the internal tooling required to support front\-end customer experiences.
* Inspire, mentor, and lead a variety of designers on the User Experience team.
* Work strategically with executives and team members across the organization.
* Develop and nurture relationships across the team, Amazon, and disciplines to promote collaboration and efficiency on Amazon projects.

  

About the team  

We are a global organization spanning market research, UX research, and UX design that leads the strategic direction, design strategy, innovation, and customer experience for the Devices shopping experience on Amazon.com and automation \& scaling tools. We execute market \& UX research that informs Device hardware, software, marketing strategies, and shopping customer experience. We design platforms and programs to support device sales and engagement in e\-commerce across shopping platforms, and execute ideas from start to end. We strongly believe in a collaborative team culture and encourage cross\-team partnership and bonding to drive innovation and maintain a safe and inclusive community.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 6\+ years of design experience
* Have an available online portfolio
* Experience in delivering design solutions for projects of large scope and complexity

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and creating personas and journey maps
* Experience with UX design of complex workflows

title: SATCOM Validation Engineer - Customer Terminal, Customer Terminal
description:
DESCRIPTION


Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low latency, high\-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Come work at Amazon!  

  

Key job responsibilities  

As a Satellite Terminal Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for Customer Terminal (CT) integration and validation with hardware, software, and firmware. You will be working in a collaborative environment with a multi\-disciplinary team. In this role, your responsibilities include:  

* Define CT systems architectures and specifications
* Design tradeoffs of various CT architectures including RF and performance simulation to support tradeoff decisions
* Develop integration \& test Software \& Firmware for lab verification measurements.
* Develop, maintain, and support customer terminal validation hardware and software
* Proactive engagement with internal and external development partners on Systems’ hardware and software architectures and implementation
* Ensure delivered work meets technical, functional, performance, regulatory and business requirements
* Perform in\-field test and validation of various CT architectures
* Traveling up to 20% of the time, depending on project phases

  

Export Control Requirement:  

Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.  

  

A day in the life  

As a Satellite Terminal Validation Engineer on the Kuiper Customer Terminal Team, you will work daily with electrical hardware, RF, antenna, silicon, and product design engineers, as well as software and operations teams in a collaborative environment. Your focus will be on architecting, integrating, and verifying customer terminal functional performance to ensure it delights our customers.  

  

About the team  

The Kuiper Customer Terminal team is responsible for developing both outdoor \& indoor devices, enabling customers internet service via the Kuiper satellite network. We own the entire process from early prototypes through mass production including requirements documents, architecture definition, hardware development, and all integration/verification testing.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of programming with at least one modern language such as C\+\+, C\#, Java, Python, Matlab, Golang, PowerShell, Ruby experience
* 3\+ years of deploying and operating in a Linux/Unix environment experience
* 3\+ years of systems design, software development, operations, automation, and process improvement experience
* Experience leading the design, build and deployment of complex and performant (reliable and scalable) software solutions in production
* BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field
* 3\+ years in SW/HW development environment with at least 3 recent year in architectural/system role
* 3\+ years experience in development for complex telecommunication, high speed digital, antenna, and/or satellite communication systems

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full software/hardware/networks development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, certification, and livesite operations
* Experience working with mobility satellite terminals such as maritime and aeronautical.
* Experience developing in LabView and Matlab
* Experience taking a leading role in building complex software or computing infrastructure that has been successfully delivered to customers
* Master/PhD degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
* Familiar with satellite communication theory
* Familiar with phased array designs and implementations
* Satellite over\-the\-air Communication field\-trial experience
* Debugging skills for systems integration from RF front\-end to baseband

title: Applied Scientist, WW Integrated Marketing Systems & Intelligence
description:
DESCRIPTION


WW Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) is seeking a highly motivated Applied Scientist to develop machine learning solutions that transform how Amazon reaches and engages customers at global scale.  

  

In this role, you will partner with scientists, engineers, and product managers across the US and EU to design and deploy models that power personalized, automated marketing across the funnel—from awareness to conversion. You will take ownership of the end\-to\-end scientific process: from problem framing and data exploration, to model development, evaluation, and deployment in production systems.  

  

You will work on high\-impact, customer\-facing initiatives that require innovative use of ML and statistical methods, including response prediction, content selection, attribution modeling, and experimentation design. Your ability to combine deep analytical thinking with a strong understanding of scalable systems will be key to delivering measurable business value.  

  

To be successful, you must be comfortable working independently in a fast\-paced environment, balancing short\-term delivery with long\-term innovation. You should demonstrate scientific rigor, strong coding and modeling skills, and the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly to both technical and business stakeholders.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

WW Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) is seeking a highly motivated Applied Scientist to transform how Amazon reaches and engages customers at global scale. WIMSI’s mission is to build the most measurably effective, creatively impactful, and cross\-channel campaigning capabilities possible, with the aim of growing "big\-bet" programs, strengthening positive brand perceptions, and increasing long\-term free cash flow. As a science team, we're tackling complex challenges in marketing incrementality measurement, optimization and audience segmentation. In this role, you'll collaborate with a diverse team of scientists and economists to build and enhance causal measurement, optimization and prediction models for Amazon's global multi\-billion dollar fixed marketing budget. You'll also work closely with various teams to develop scientific roadmaps, drive innovation, and influence key resource allocation decisions.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Innovating scalable marketing methodologies using causal inference and machine learning.
* Developing interpretable models that provide actionable business insights.
* Collaborating with engineers to automate and scale scientific solutions.
* Engaging with stakeholders to ensure effective adoption of scientific products.
* Presenting findings to the Amazon Science community to promote excellence and knowledge\-sharing.

  

About the team  

The Worldwide Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) Tech team builds foundational technology for Amazon’s marketing funnel—from brand\-building to product discovery and conversion.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of building models for business application experience
* PhD, or Master's degree and 4\+ years of CS, CE, ML or related field experience
* Experience in patents or publications at top\-tier peer\-reviewed conferences or journals
* Experience programming in Java, C\+\+, Python or related language
* Experience in any of the following areas: algorithms and data structures, parsing, numerical optimization, data mining, parallel and distributed computing, high\-performance computing

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience using Unix/Linux
* Experience in professional software development

WW Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) is seeking a highly motivated Applied Scientist to develop machine learning solutions that transform how Amazon reaches and engages customers at global scale.  

  

In this role, you will partner with scientists, engineers, and product managers across the US and EU to design and deploy models that power personalized, automated marketing across the funnel—from awareness to conversion. You will take ownership of the end\-to\-end scientific process: from problem framing and data exploration, to model development, evaluation, and deployment in production systems.  

  

You will work on high\-impact, customer\-facing initiatives that require innovative use of ML and statistical methods, including response prediction, content selection, attribution modeling, and experimentation design. Your ability to combine deep analytical thinking with a strong understanding of scalable systems will be key to delivering measurable business value.  

  

To be successful, you must be comfortable working independently in a fast\-paced environment, balancing short\-term delivery with long\-term innovation. You should demonstrate scientific rigor, strong coding and modeling skills, and the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly to both technical and business stakeholders.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

WW Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) is seeking a highly motivated Applied Scientist to transform how Amazon reaches and engages customers at global scale. WIMSI’s mission is to build the most measurably effective, creatively impactful, and cross\-channel campaigning capabilities possible, with the aim of growing "big\-bet" programs, strengthening positive brand perceptions, and increasing long\-term free cash flow. As a science team, we're tackling complex challenges in marketing incrementality measurement, optimization and audience segmentation. In this role, you'll collaborate with a diverse team of scientists and economists to build and enhance causal measurement, optimization and prediction models for Amazon's global multi\-billion dollar fixed marketing budget. You'll also work closely with various teams to develop scientific roadmaps, drive innovation, and influence key resource allocation decisions.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Innovating scalable marketing methodologies using causal inference and machine learning.
* Developing interpretable models that provide actionable business insights.
* Collaborating with engineers to automate and scale scientific solutions.
* Engaging with stakeholders to ensure effective adoption of scientific products.
* Presenting findings to the Amazon Science community to promote excellence and knowledge\-sharing.

  

About the team  

The Worldwide Integrated Marketing Systems and Intelligence (WIMSI) Tech team builds foundational technology for Amazon’s marketing funnel—from brand\-building to product discovery and conversion.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of building models for business application experience
* PhD, or Master's degree and 4\+ years of CS, CE, ML or related field experience
* Experience in patents or publications at top\-tier peer\-reviewed conferences or journals
* Experience programming in Java, C\+\+, Python or related language
* Experience in any of the following areas: algorithms and data structures, parsing, numerical optimization, data mining, parallel and distributed computing, high\-performance computing

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience using Unix/Linux
* Experience in professional software development

title: Product Marketing Manager, Amazon Business
description:
DESCRIPTION


Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $35 billion global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space, developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination, and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.  

  

This role is part of the Amazon Business WW Marketing team and our vision is to establish Amazon Business as the most recognized B2B brand. In this role, you will lead the strategy and production of engaging onsite experiences, and champion event production across cross\-functional teams. This includes merchandising events and seasonal promotions globally on Amazon Business. This role will need to communicate regularly with senior leadership and be responsible for driving top\-level business goals.  

  

To be successful in this role, this individual will work seamlessly with senior stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Category, Selection, Pricing, and Tech across geographic regions to optimize through scale and continuous experimentation. We are looking for an individual with broad experience in online merchandising, digital marketing, and product marketing. This role requires skills in strategic thinking, relationship building, and problem solving, as well as a willingness to be hands\-on with execution.
  

  

The ideal candidate has a track record of success in delivering results at scale and working cross\-functionally across multiple teams and countries. The individual will thrive in a fast\-paced, high\-pressure entrepreneurial environment. If you’re looking to join a dynamic, growing team in a high\-impact role, this is a great fit for you.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Own WW strategy and production of onsite events and seasonal promotions (e.g., Back to School, Black Friday) on Amazon Business
* Deliver multi\-channel marketing campaigns and engaging onsite experiences for B2B customers
* Develop detailed campaign project plans, creative briefs, and digital strategies, including campaign goals, messaging, calls to action, segmentation strategy, marketing distribution channels, and campaign schedule
* Apply key insights into business actions and push for new ways to achieve objectives at scale
* Define business metrics, measurement plan, and testing plan for site\-event events
* Work at both the strategic and tactical level to champion bold, creative ideas
* Test and refine new marketing approaches and channels to reach and engage key audiences
* Create and maintain scalable, repeatable methods of measurement and performance tracking for campaigns
* Manage multiple projects gracefully and balancing contending priorities in a rapidly changing environment

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 2\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
* Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
* Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional programs or marketing campaigns from concept to completion
* Experience managing and measuring marketing performance in various channels

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 4\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience managing external partners to develop marketing programs
* Experience presenting ideas to various levels of an organization to gain support for initiatives

title: Principal TM Business Partner, D&S Talent Management
description:
• Minimum 10 years of experience leading relevant talent programs, including experience leading cross\-functional, global projects.
• Strong background in building an overall talent strategy in a highly ambiguous, flexible environment.
• Strong data\-driven, business writing skills.
• Executive presence and ability to influence senior leaders.
• Experience in talent management, organizational network analysis, organizational design and development.
  

Amazon Devices is the team behind the best\-selling Amazon Echo \& Alexa devices, Kindle e\-reader, Fire tablet, Fire TV, and Dash Button product lines. Devices hosts a highly diverse and innovative 24k\+ employee base in software and hardware engineering, supply chain and manufacturing, to product and program management distributed across 30\+ countries.
The Principal, Talent Management Business Partner (TMBP) role will build a holistic, integrated talent strategy for certain business leaders within the Amazon Devices business, alongside their TMBP peers, while rolling up their sleeves to deliver and own end\-to\-end organization wide org effectiveness solutions. The Principal will conduct organization level analyses to uncover meaningful insights on critical talent issues. They will partner closely with PXT (HR) leaders and business leaders to drive organizational design efforts, and build/manage talent experiences and mechanisms, while also connecting intentionally with other Devices PXT COEs, Amazon Global Talent Management teams, and other Talent Management experts to continuously scale solutions, learn from other ongoing or new efforts, and strengthen skillsets and expertise.
This is a great opportunity for a strong systems thinker and builder to directly impact mechanisms we use to assess, grow, retain, and place Amazon Devices talent. This position provides invaluable exposure to broad HR strategic efforts where you can strongly influence. As a senior member of talent management, this role provides ample opportunity to design and innovate solutions for, and regularly communicate with, HR and business leadership.
The ideal candidate must be self\-driven, possess a high degree of ownership and have strong people and business acumen, excellent business writing and influencing skills, refined planning/project management skills, and should thrive working in a fast\-paced and ambiguous environment. This role requires dealing with a high level of autonomy and feeling comfortable organizing and operating in a space with little direction for solving hard, complex talent and business problems. There is no opportunity in this role to outsource work to external consultants, so candidates must have strong ownership, grit, and drive for results.
The successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of:
• Knowing Your Customers. Understand their priorities, what they are saying, and more importantly, what they aren’t. Deliver and drive value for them.
• Innovation. Appreciate what exists, identify why it works. Then rebuild it or build something different that derives even MORE value and a better customer experience.
• Judgment. Take different perspectives and business needs, develop a solution that works, move the ball forward. Be able to support your opinions with sound reasoning grounded in the business.
• Systems Thinker. Understand all the connections and integration points through the entire talent management lifecycle.
• Thinking Big. How do we build it bigger, better, faster? What aren’t we thinking of?
• Research driven. We form hypotheses about the best talent management techniques and then set out to prove or disprove them with experiments and careful data collection. 
• Prioritization. There will be a constant flow of work, both tactical and strategic. Determine what gets done first and why, while managing a plan for what to do with everything else.
• Building relationships. Partner with Devices HR COE teams, HR Business Partners, Business Leaders, and corporate COE teams. Share best practices, partner on solutions, and move the organizations forward together.
• Consulting. Utilize past experience, deep knowledge of processes and policies, and knowing what’s going on across our organization to create custom solutions and localize as needed.
• Communicating. Share your ideas, listen to others, follow\-up, and follow\-up again. Clarify that your solution will solve the business problem, and use the language of the business and avoid “consultant speak”.
• Resourcefulness. If you don’t know it, that’s ok. But you should know where to go for the answer or how to find out.
• Bias for Action and dealing with ambiguity. Sometimes it is not clear how we are going to get there. Can you help carve a path? How fast can you do it? What are the tradeoffs? Take risks and be willing to try new things, fail fast and iterate.
Key job responsibilities
• Design the overall talent review strategy in partnership with the PXT (HR) and business leader, including promotions, succession planning, talent development, long\-term talent planning, and organizational reviews; design a holistic system for talent programs that deliver meaningful insight on critical talent issues and builds a strong and diverse senior leader bench and pipeline; this includes clear inputs, simplified processes, and actionable outcomes, feeding one talent process to another throughout the year. 
• Talent Management, Assessment, and Review: Build innovative, scalable talent assessment and review mechanisms to grow and retain critical senior leader talent, including proposals for new programs like rotating senior leader talent in to hard\-to\-fill and/or critical roles. 
• Recognize where there may be gaps between global and business\-specific needs. Creatively find solutions to fill these gaps, where appropriate. Influence the D\&S, AADA, and global talent teams by advocating for change and sharing best practices.
• Partner with our Analytics team to automate talent reporting and building innovative tools to uncover talent insights and drive strategic talent discussions.
• Benchmark best practices for strategic talent management experiences, and work backward from the business problem and employee experience to implement solutions that make sense.
• Program manage and own select talent management programs built for the Amazon Devices organization, or Amazon\-wide. 
• Measure and assess the impact of tools and resources introduced to the organization. Continually evaluate solutions for quality, business impact, scalability and sustainability. Conduct post launch evaluations to understand successes and improvement opportunities while establishing methods for sustained adoption.
  

* Ability to convey ideas and recommendations in a clear, compelling and succinct way in written and verbal communications
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities
* Self\-starter who can work independently in a fast\-paced, ambiguous environment
* Experience identifying and resolving issues independently, will take initiative even under unfamiliar or ambiguous circumstances. Strong bias for action and “gets stuff done” attitude
* Exceptional analytical skills, comfortable working with large amounts of data and communicating data findings, including experience establishing and tracking program metrics
* Proven success in a large fast paced, preferably technology\-driven, organization
* Understanding of experimental design and testing of ideas that justifies ROI on solutions
* Experience handling confidential information with discretion.

title: Payload RF-Testing , Characterization and Operation for Payload System
description:
\- • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related discipline, or 5\+ years of RF, satellite, aerospace or related industry experience.
\- • 2\+ years’ experience in in RF design and/or verification with launched products
\- • Experience in embedded C and/or C\+\+ programming
  

As a Payload System Characterization Integration and RF\-Test Engineer, you will engage with an experienced cross\-disciplinary team to integrate and test the Kuiper\-Modem. You will work closely with colleagues throughout Project Kuiper’s to integrate ASIC, HW, RF, and SW in one single product solution. You will be part of the lifecycle of the development and deployment of the final integrated product.
As a member of Kuiper Payload System Characterization team, you will be responsible for integrating the various subsystems RF, modem, SW\-stack, etc. to build the product. During this process you will be conducting tests, validating each sub\-system functionalities and optimizing the end\-to\-end system
Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.
Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Key job responsibilities
• Integrating various communication Modem functionalities into a single system; from RF (air\-interface) to the top layer of the communication stack
• Specifying and defining test plans to cover the system functionalities with its diverse use cases
• Building various test beds to enable system testing; e.g., setups of antenna, modem, measurement equipment, etc.
• Configuring test equipment for automated operation: satellite link emulator, spectrum analyzer, signal generator, etc.
• Interpreting test results, troubleshooting issues, performing root\-cause analysis for any test failures
• Specifying with other teams, the various KPIs and metrics required to span the whole system characterization
  

* • Experience in wireless technology e.g., 4G/5G, Bluetooth, …
* • Experience and hands\-on in wireless FW/SW development
* • Experience with communication theory and RF\-systems; e.g., OFDM, MIMO, etc.
* • Experience working with different chip interfaces/layers e.g., RF, PHY, etc.
* • Experience in wireless (satellite and/or terrestrial) system architecture, design and/or implementation.
* • Experience of end\-to\-end system integration and testing
* • Experience with on\-orbit payload verification or satellite testing
* • Hands\-on experience with RF measurement equipment, including power meters, spectrum analyzer, vector signal generators, network analyzers, oscilloscopes.

title: Senior Product Manager - Tech, FinTech Accounting
description:
\- 5\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
\- Experience managing technical products or online services
\- Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
  

Are you interested in building high\-performance, globally scalable Financial systems and infrastructure that support Amazon's current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Does the prospect of working with top finance and engineering talent get you charged up? If so, Amazon Finance Technology (FinTech) is for you!
Amazon FinTech is looking for a Senior Product Manager Technical (PM\-T) to deliver long term scalable product that will help our Accounting and Finance customers improve financial reconciliations processes, accelerate financial close cycle, enhance controllership and reduce manual effort through automation.
We are seeking an experienced, results\-oriented, self\-motivated Technical Product Manager, having a bent for solving complex problems and delivering high quality technical products. You will be responsible for developing product strategy, defining product requirements working with global internal accounting teams, influencing stakeholders and engineering teams required to deliver an impactful product.
The ideal candidate for this role will have strong ownership, business and product sense combined with good understanding of AI and ML applications, specific use cases, enjoy diving deep on complex processes, engaging with senior leaders to drive change, be an educator who inspires by sharing knowledge in an accessible way, and finally collaborate cross\-functionally to deliver sustainable results.
You will need to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment without being hindered by ambiguity. High judgment, ability to influence, analytical talent, ability to partner with technical and non\-technical stakeholders and leadership, data and doc writing, have strong attention to detail and polished communication skills are essential to success in this role.
Key job responsibilities
\- Define product requirements and execution strategy of AI applications, which matches our overall strategy
\- Lead the product life cycle including vision, strategy, roadmap, requirements, user experience, delivery, launch, and support.
\- Work with engineering, research, UX, technical program managers and stakeholders on driving initiatives and delivering a successful product
\- Collaborate with Amazon partner tech teams to ensure product re\-usability and avoid redundancies.
\- Managing both upwards and downwards communications effectively
A day in the life
\- Create an integrated and prioritized intake mechanism
\- Increase product adoption across finance, tax and accounting through office hours, demos and trainings.
\- Write BRDs and business use cases.
\- Experiment and explore novel AI solutions by developing Proof of Concept ideas that can be scaled into full\-fledged applications.
\- Participate and influences the central AI initiatives by being the voice of customer in these discussions.
\- Join and shape leadership discussion through product vision
\- Be a customer obsessed thought leader who dives deep on customer facing defects to find a scalable solution.
About the team
FinTech’s charter is to enable Finance \& Global Business Services (FGBS) teams, and amplify the benefit of FGBS teams to support the growth, expansion, and restructuring of the businesses. The Close Systems team owns coordination, execution and continuous improvement for month close processes across FGBS teams. We own developing automation to scale with Amazon’s growth, reduce manual effort and defects, streamline processes, and drive accountability across teams. The Close Systems team improves the financial close by developing automation to scale with Amazon’s growth, reduce manual effort and defects, streamline processes, and drive accountability across teams.
  

* Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools
* Experience performing statistical analysis of data using SQL, Excel and other tools
* Excellent communicator with the ability to deal with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization and in particular the Product \& Tech sphere.
* Experience building products and project management and hands\-on experience using project management tools/mechanisms such as Asana/Sprint/Kanban
* Deep Knowledge of LLM/AI and is up\-to\-date with current AI developments.

title: Network Dev Engineer II, GCNA-D
description:
\- 4\+ years of major internet routing protocols experience
\- 4\+ years of working in a Linux/Unix environment experience
\- 1\+ years of automation scripting using Python, Bash, Shell and/or Perl experience
  

Do you like to use network and Unix systems engineering to deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions? Would you like your work to play a key role in driving the stability and sustainability of next\-generation IP networks?
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Are you a Network Engineer with experience building automated solutions who enjoys working in a fast paced and collaborative environment? Amazon.com is looking for best\-in\-class Network Engineers to help deploy, scale and automate one of the world’s largest and complex networks. With Amazon Web Services, our goal is to become “The Infrastructure Platform” to the world. Our customers demand the highest quality and reliability for their services. We are expanding at a tremendous rate it is our responsibility to maintain quality and reliability while developing innovative ways to automate the scaling of our network.
Key job responsibilities
Network Development Engineers perform high quality network and/or systems operations, deployments, scaling, technology refresh, sustaining engineering, best practices application, optimization, internal/external customer interactions, and produce appropriate technical documentation.
• Be responsible for automation of deploying network infrastructure across all of our network fabrics that supports the Amazon Retail Service, Kindle, Payments and multiple AWS services.
• Deploy, scale and automate our network across multiple global datacenters. This includes existing footprints and greenfield locations.
• Drive scaling of current network designs to meet the demand of our customers.
• Create simple, repetitive deployment processes that increase both velocity and quality.
• Work closely with our internal customers on designs/solutions; bringing those designs/solutions from concept to production.
• Create and update our network standards and ensure that the network is deployed to these standards.
• Create and implement changes on the network.
• Automate workfow and execution of deployments on a global scale
• Work closely with our automation teams in transitioning and designing new tools that allow us to scale at unprecedented volume
A day in the life
Engineers in the Internet Edge organization have a wide range of responsibilities: we evolve routing policy, implement traffic engineering solutions, grow our peering footprint, secure the “front door” from bad actors on the Internet, and architect the hardware platforms and network design to support any Amazon product that needs to reach end\-users worldwide. Our infrastructure moves terabits of traffic to and from the Internet at any given moment, and represents one of the largest edge surface areas in the world, requiring complex solutions to ensure that capacity always stays ahead of demand. To accomplish that, our engineers develop automation, write software, and work with a wide range of partner teams to continually improve and automate our Internet connectivity in areas such as capacity delivery, configuration deployment, impairment detection, and traffic optimization. Internet Edge engineers make decisions on both a day\-to\-day and long\-term strategic basis, which carry a large amount of responsibility and impact across all of Amazon’s products.
• Work in a 24x7 team on call rotation, with ability to drive into workplace for critical events/needs. 
• Manage customers during problem resolution and operating efficiently under pressure.
• Sit at the computer during scheduled work hours with appropriate breaks while maintaining a high level of alertness and attention to detail.
• Travel to data center/network sites and Amazon/customer offices as needed.
About the team
Internet Edge provides high\-performing Internet connectivity for a wide range of use cases, such as retail (amazon.com), video streaming (Prime Video), content delivery (CloudFront), DNS (Route53\), AWS services (such as EC2/S3\), consumer devices (such as FireTV/Kindle/Echo), and more.
Within AWS Networking, the Internet Edge organization is responsible for connecting Amazon to the global Internet. With connections to thousands of unique external networks in hundreds of locations across the world, our mission is to deliver an Internet connectivity experience that sets the global standard for performance, availability, security, and cost, making Amazon the clear choice for our customers’ needs.
About AWS
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. title: Senior Category Sourcing Manager, Networking OEM
description:
\- 6\+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
\- 6\+ years of professional or military experience
\- Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, Business, Supply Chain, Quantitative, Technical or quantitative field
\- 6\+ years of experience working with engineering teams to develop technology roadmaps and supporting sourcing strategies
\- 6\+ years of experience working with executive business partners both internally and externally to drive alignment to strategies
  

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
The Networking team is looking for a results\-oriented individual to own technical sourcing activities for OEM networking hardware and software. This individual will own strategy and relationship development with multiple Networking OEM partners who supply switches, routers, optics, firewalls, and other critical networking infrastructure for AWS. This individual will partner closely with multiple network engineering teams to define the OEM hardware and software roadmap for the AWS network will create sourcing strategies to enable favorable material availability, cost, and support terms. Our Category Sourcing Managers are experts in their industries and drive the explosive growth of AWS by enabling disruptive technologies through responsible and strategic sourcing.
Key job responsibilities
\- Develop OEM networking hardware and software sourcing strategies to deliver against business and engineering objectives and achieve sustainable relationships with strategic suppliers 
\- Partner closely with the network engineering teams to identify and strategize about hardware and feature set needs to drive a multi\-year technology strategy 
\- Analyze industry trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base opportunities to minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, optimize cost, and utilize industry developments that benefit Amazon 
\- Influence suppliers' manufacturing processes, technology decisions, and policies in ways that are mutually beneficial and sustainable for both organizations by leveraging the growth of Amazon's spend. 
\- Negotiate and implement supplier agreements/contracts by working with cross\-functional business partners and suppliers to reach agreement on contract terms and conditions. \- Analyze and determine cost reduction opportunities by leveraging volumes, optimizing the supplier base and reducing total cost of ownership. 
\- Lead sourcing engagements and competitive bidding (RFI, RFQ, and RFP). 
\- Track internal metrics for executing projects and sourcing plans. 
\- Make optimal trade\-offs between schedule, resources, and scope, and apply advanced technical and business knowledge to address major risks, challenges, and obstacles. 
\- Help develop long\-term department strategies and significantly influence the cross\-company project development and delivery processes and standards. 
\- Be a subject matter expert for the customers, technologies, and markets in which you engage 
\- Keys to success in this role include sound judgment and excellent written/verbal communication skills. The candidate should be able to extract insights from data and be able to communicate clearly appropriate triggers and actions.
A day in the life
You will be working closely with several business partners to manage the Networking OEM category on a day to day basis. This will include interactions with hardware development teams, network design and deployment engineering teams, rack integration, finance, legal, and others. You will also manage working and executive level supplier relationships with multiple Networking OEMs as well as rack integration partners. You will be heavily focused on roadmap planning and execution against a technology migration strategy. You will work with closely with two individuals from your immediate core category team (GSM and PLM) to drive and execute a well\-rounded category strategy (GCM \= You, GSM \= Global Supply Manager, PLM \= Product Lifecycle Manager). You will leverage your expertise to build supplier relationships and architect agreements to support AWS' growing network. You will make responsible sourcing decisions that consider customer security, time to market, technology benefit, quality and cost.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance
We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
A Little About the Team
The Networking team is made up of global category managers (GCM), global supply managers (GSM), and product lifecycle managers (PLM) who manage the broad base of networking suppliers and internal amazon initiatives that help build the AWS cloud. We drive supply continuity, cost optimization, and technology introduction for networking hardware. We are located throughout multiple regional hubs in the united states and work with suppliers and business partners globally. We are a mix of industry experts and those aspiring to grow our industry expertise. We all bring something valuable to the table from our unique backgrounds; we highlight and celebrate our diverse backgrounds and leverage them to our collective benefit as a team.
  

* MBA or advanced degree
* Background in OEM hardware and software procurement
* Experience in the Enterprise Networking, Hyperscale Networking, Cloud Computing/Storage or other IT Infrastructure industries
* Background in semiconductor industry with working knowledge of supply dependencies
* Experience working at, for, or with Hyperscale cloud provider
* Strong understanding of off\-the\-shelf and custom electronics equipment sourcing
* Must be able to present complex technology and business objectives in concise and understandable manner
* Must have backbone to push back on decisions that do not align with business objectives and propose alternate solutions

title: Senior Manager, Kuiper Trust and Privacy, Kuiper Worldwide Consumer
description:
\- 6\+ years of team management experience
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- 3\+ years experience in trust and privacy
  

Project Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.
This position defines Privacy compliance and Trust obligations and drives large cross functional implementation initiatives at Kuiper. This includes working with a large set of business and technical leaders as well as central Privacy functions at Devices and engineering tools to build both processes and tools to raise the Privacy bar.
This role is inherently cross\-functional and requires a strong ability to influence others \- you will work closely with teams across the company, including Legal, PR, Public Policy, engineering, and business owners. You must be able to effectively partner to deliver privacy goals, including continually improving the corresponding processes and technology and trusted to operate with independence.
Key job responsibilities
You will leverage your deep trust and privacy experience to drive large\-scale efforts that solve significant problems. You will decompose complex privacy processes into straight\-forward solutions, often inventing new ones. We are looking for a critical thinker who is also technically adept and thrives on solving challenges in partnership with teams across Kuiper and Devices. You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that’s higher than many programs and display high levels of bias for action, earning trust and ownership.
This position will be responsible for the following activities:
\* Identifying and driving compliance to global privacy\-related regulations, policies, and customer promises across all of Amazon.
\* Creating clear guidance for developers, product managers and other Amazonians to understand applicable Privacy controls and steps to manage compliance.
\* Partnering with legal, public policy, public relations, and other teams to identify emerging Privacy\-related regulatory, market or other compliance needs.
\* Deep diving existing strategic solutions and implementations to enable Amazon teams to meet Compliance controls.
\* Working with product and engineering teams on development of new privacy tools to enable compliance at scale.
\* Developing and effectively communicating Privacy policies and standards.
\* Driving effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities.
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
A day in the life
This role requires Privacy thought leaders that love Privacy and solving complex problems with a large and diverse set of colleagues. You will work with legal and public policy teams to stay abreast of the Privacy landscape. You will then prioritize key initiatives to drive across Amazon, creating clear and simple guidance and identifying the in\-scope stakeholders and necessary compliance tools. You will then create and execute action plans to drive compliance while reporting to executive management on progress. This job is located in Redmond, WA.
  

* Experience as a product manager or owner

title: Sr. Product Manager - Tech
description:
\- 5\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience as a product manager or owner
\- Experience owning technology products
  

Are you passionate about driving innovation and improving business processes through technology? Do you thrive on the challenge of delivering large, cross\-functional projects that have a significant impact on the organization? If so, this role as a Product Manager for Amazon Legal Technology may be the perfect opportunity for you.
As a Product Manager for the Amazon Legal Technology team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the tools and systems used to manage contracts across Amazon's global Legal department and business teams. You will be responsible for owning and driving the roadmap, development, and delivery of the software solutions that power Amazon's contract management processes.
To be successful in this role, you will need:
\* Proven experience as a Product Manager, ideally in a legal, enterprise software, or highly regulated industry
\* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex requirements into elegant technical solutions
\* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to align cross\-functional teams
\* A passion for driving user\-centric innovation and delivering measurable business impact
\* Flexibility, organization, and a roll\-up\-your\-sleeves work ethic
If you're excited by the prospect of transforming contract management at one of the world's most innovative companies, we'd love to hear from you.
Key job responsibilities
\* Work closely with software engineering teams to design, build, and launch new features and capabilities for the Legal technology platform
\* Collaborate with Legal and business stakeholders to deeply understand their needs, pain points, and requirements around contract management
\* Develop the product vision, strategy, and roadmap to continuously improve the user experience and drive productivity gains
\* Manage the full product lifecycle, from ideation and planning to release and ongoing optimization
\* Run the user community, gathering feedback, writing user stories, and prioritizing the product backlog
\* Ensure customer requirements are met by working in an agile software development model
  

* Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights
* Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders

title: Executive Social Media Specialist, Devices & Services
description:
\- 5\+ years of recent professional communications or public relations experience
\- Bachelor's degree
  

We’re seeking a high\-judgement, data\-driven, and detail\-oriented communications professional to support executive social media communications and social\-first storytelling for the Amazon Devices \& Services (D\&S) business. This individual will help drive the day\-to\-day execution of our executive communications program, with a particular focus on social media strategy for our most senior leaders\- delivering weekly social content informed by data and business priorities, advocating for creative new approaches in line with our all\-up strategic goals, and sharing best practices with other teams. In addition, they will partner with our corporate social media team, identifying compelling ways to share our story with audiences via Amazon's social media channels.
This individual will also support other aspects of our executive communications program, playing a key role in strategic planning and owning program management (vetting, tracking, and supporting 
engagements like media interviews, speaking engagements, and internal events). They will write talking points, employee communications, and other materials on behalf of our leaders, and will also own key cross\-team mechanisms and resources like a spokesperson training program, executive social media center of excellence, and messaging/Q\&A repository.
This individual will collaborate closely with product PR teams, other executive communications teams, and the executive’s office to deliver a best\-in\-class program—notably creative content that consistently beats 
benchmarks and grows the executive’s social following. The ideal candidate will be 
a strong writer with an ability to capture an executive’s voice/style, and 
someone with experience communicating strategically across channels. This candidate must have the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders, navigate a large\-scale, complex business, bring creativity and 
fresh thinking to the program, and scale learnings/mechanisms to help the 
broader team achieve their goal.
Key job responsibilities
\-Lead the end\-to\-end execution of a senior executive’s social media presence, including content sourcing, drafting posts and visuals, and tracking engagement metrics.
\- Oversee the broader Devices \& Services executive social media program, collaborating with PR leads to align messaging and content across leaders, especially around key milestones and product launches.
\-Maintain and regularly update an executive activity tracker, coordinating with key stakeholders through weekly updates and monthly review meetings.
\-Manage cross\-functional spokesperson training efforts in partnership with product communications leads.
\-Own the development and regular updates of cross\-organizational messaging, briefing, and Q\&A documents.
\-Drive the creation of key briefing materials, including interview prep documents and internal communications content.
\-Contribute to strategic planning processes by helping to draft annual and biannual planning documents.
  

* Executive Communications
* Executive Social Media
* Media Relations

title: Principal Executive Development and Coaching, Global Executive Development
description:
• 5\+ years of Executive\-level coaching including a minimum of PCC certification through ICF or equivalent governing body.
• 10\+ years of leadership experience in a complex business environment.
• Strong facilitation skills both in\-person and virtual delivery forums.
• Ability to travel both domestically and globally 30% of working schedule.
• Certified in and experience delivering 360 and other psychometric assessments.
• Strong understanding of group development, adults learning methodology 
• Global and cross cultural appreciation and experience developing leaders, designing and delivering learning solutions in multiple countries and across diverse cultures.
• Good interpersonal and leadership skills; a role model for the use of the concepts and skills we teach.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ideally as an author or content creator on relevant topics.
• Strong analytical skills and experience using and presenting data to make decisions.
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience is required.
  

Amazon's Global Executive Development (GED) team is seeking a Principal, Leadership Development and Executive Coaching to shape and deliver transformative learning experiences for Amazon's senior leaders (Directors and Vice Presidents). This role combines learning design expertise with executive coaching and facilitation skills to create and deliver innovative leadership development solutions.
The ideal candidate will design global leadership programs while providing facilitation and strategic coaching support as needed. You'll craft immersive learning experiences, develop curriculum, and deliver coaching that helps leaders enhance their leadership capabilities. This dual focus allows you to both shape the learning journey and support leaders through their development.
While this is an individual contributor role, you'll collaborate with senior leaders and development professionals worldwide. Success requires strong instructional design expertise, coaching credentials, and the gravitas to partner with senior leaders. You'll also contribute to program innovation by analyzing leadership trends and creating strategic recommendations for program enhancement.
Key job responsibilities
Design \& Development
• Create engaging leadership development curricula and learning experiences
• Design innovative coaching frameworks and development tools
• Develop measurement strategies to assess program effectiveness
• Craft experiential learning activities and resources to promote learning in the flow of work
Strategic Impact
• Analyze leadership capability requirements and trends
• Transform insights into actionable learning solutions
• Track and measure program effectiveness
• Contribute to the continuous improvement of development offerings
Facilitation \& Coaching
• Facilitate leadership development programs and learning sessions
• Provide strategic executive coaching to senior leaders
• Lead breakout sessions and peer learning discussions
• Guide participants through leadership assessments and feedback
A day in the life
You will never have a boring day in this role. You'll balance designing innovative learning experiences with delivering impactful coaching and facilitation. Our fast\-paced environment offers opportunities to shape leadership development solutions while working directly with senior leaders.
About the team
We are a small, scrappy team combining research\-based approaches with Amazon's leadership principles to build future\-ready leaders. No task is too small, or too big, and there is never anything that isn't in our job description. We love Learning, Being Curious, and Delivering Results!
  

* MCC level coaching certification with ICF or equivalent governing body.
* 10\+ years of executive coaching experience for senior level leaders
* Experience with team/group coaching at the executive level.
* Experience with leadership simulations and other intensive, experiential training methodologies.
* Strong understanding of capabilities necessary to lead in large scale, rapidly growing, highly innovative organizations.
* Experience developing other senior facilitators and trainers.
* Familiarity with business, financial, and process improvement tools, concepts and methodologies.

title: Solutions Architect, Buy with Prime and Multi-Channel Fulfillment (MCF)
description:
\- 2\+ years of design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures experience
\- 4\+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data \& analytics) experience
  

Unbox your potential! Amazon Buy with Prime (BwP) and Multi\-Channel Fulfillment (MCF) are looking for a strong leader to help us continue to build our e\-commerce and supply chain solutions. We offer a unique opportunity to join a high\-visibility organization that will be a significant driver for the company’s growth and will reimagine the way people shop and merchants sell. We are looking for a highly motivated Solutions Architect (SA) to join our team. You will be the trusted partner working shoulder to shoulder with our customers and advising them on how to best achieve performance at scale.
Candidates should have a proven track record of working with large consumer brands across a range of categories with a deep understanding and network in eCommerce. As a Solutions Architect, you will influence the future of Amazon Supply Chain Services by collaborating at the intersection of customers, partners, product, and engineering. This role involves up to 25% travel, including customer site visits, industry conferences, and team meetings at various locations.
The role requires deep technical expertise, a strong sense of technical evangelism, and a relentless commitment to long term customer outcomes. You will be expected to quickly understand technical architectures, research, build, and deliver proof of concept solutions to pattern and guide and shape the customer journey. You should be a passionate tinkerer, and be able to dive deep, speaking to builder patterns and practices with fluency.
The ability to build repeatable artifacts, and assess deliverables as a force multiplier is a critical skill for the Solutions Architect role. You should have a demonstrated ability to think about business challenges and articulate technical solutions to solve those problems. As part of the SA community you will capture and share best practices with your peers, generate internal and external technical content, and participate in evangelist and workshop activities to grow the community.
To be successful in this role, you should:
\- Have a strong background in cloud services, app integration, API fundamentals, and be able to demonstrate technical excellence when building scalable architectures.
\- Be a passionate communicator, advisor, and advocate for the Customer.
\- Demonstrate a deep understanding of Software Development.
\- Have experience working with eCommerce and Supply Chain solutions.
\- Be passionate about developing your peers, and participating in hiring.
\- Drive feedback and influence product development, direction, and evolution.
\- Be proactive relationship building on partnerships and initiatives.
About the team
Buy with Prime (BwP) and Multi\-Channel Fulfillment (MCF) are helping people reimagine the way they shop….wherever they do! Our vision is to enable every entrepreneur in the world to reach every customer in the world through every channel they can imagine. Buy with Prime (BwP) is a new way to extend Prime shopping benefits—including fast, free shipping, a seamless checkout experience, and free returns—to merchants’ own online stores, ultimately increasing selection for Prime members. For over 20 years, Amazon been empowering small and medium\-sized businesses with opportunities to grow. Buy with Prime is an exciting next step in our mission to help merchants of all sizes grow their business—whether on Amazon or beyond.
Multi\-Channel Fulfillment (MCF) aims to enable organizations across the world with reliable, cost effective, and flexible end\-to\-end eCommerce fulfillment solutions in order to help them scale, succeed, and offer best in class experiences to their customers. MCF represents the core fulfillment capability of Buy with Prime (BwP), a new business initiative for Amazon.
  

* 4\+ years of IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries experience
* Experience working with end user or developer communities

Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. title: SATCOM Validation Engineer - Customer Terminal, Customer Terminal
description:
\- 3\+ years of programming with at least one modern language such as C\+\+, C\#, Java, Python, Matlab, Golang, PowerShell, Ruby experience
\- 3\+ years of deploying and operating in a Linux/Unix environment experience
\- 3\+ years of systems design, software development, operations, automation, and process improvement experience
\- Experience leading the design, build and deployment of complex and performant (reliable and scalable) software solutions in production
\- BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field
\- 3\+ years in SW/HW development environment with at least 3 recent year in architectural/system role
\- 3\+ years experience in development for complex telecommunication, high speed digital, antenna, and/or satellite communication systems
  

Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low latency, high\-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Come work at Amazon!
Key job responsibilities
As a Satellite Terminal Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for Customer Terminal (CT) integration and validation with hardware, software, and firmware. You will be working in a collaborative environment with a multi\-disciplinary team. In this role, your responsibilities include:
• Define CT systems architectures and specifications
• Design tradeoffs of various CT architectures including RF and performance simulation to support tradeoff decisions
• Develop integration \& test Software \& Firmware for lab verification measurements.
• Develop, maintain, and support customer terminal validation hardware and software
• Proactive engagement with internal and external development partners on Systems’ hardware and software architectures and implementation
• Ensure delivered work meets technical, functional, performance, regulatory and business requirements
• Perform in\-field test and validation of various CT architectures
• Traveling up to 20% of the time, depending on project phases
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
A day in the life
As a Satellite Terminal Validation Engineer on the Kuiper Customer Terminal Team, you will work daily with electrical hardware, RF, antenna, silicon, and product design engineers, as well as software and operations teams in a collaborative environment. Your focus will be on architecting, integrating, and verifying customer terminal functional performance to ensure it delights our customers.
About the team
The Kuiper Customer Terminal team is responsible for developing both outdoor \& indoor devices, enabling customers internet service via the Kuiper satellite network. We own the entire process from early prototypes through mass production including requirements documents, architecture definition, hardware development, and all integration/verification testing.
  

* Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full software/hardware/networks development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, certification, and livesite operations
* Experience working with mobility satellite terminals such as maritime and aeronautical.
* Experience developing in LabView and Matlab
* Experience taking a leading role in building complex software or computing infrastructure that has been successfully delivered to customers
* Master/PhD degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
* Familiar with satellite communication theory
* Familiar with phased array designs and implementations
* Satellite over\-the\-air Communication field\-trial experience
* Debugging skills for systems integration from RF front\-end to baseband

title: Sr. Product Manager - Technical (Buy with Prime / Merchant), Buy with Prime and Multi-Channel Fulfillment
description:
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
\- Experience managing technical products or online services
\- Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
\- Experience with developer platforms and developer experience (DX) design
  

We build commerce services to support merchants in growing their off\-Amazon businesses. We're looking for an experienced product manager \- technical to build innovative solutions that enable merchants of all sizes to easily integrate our commerce solutions such as Buy with Prime into their existing front\-end (e.g., Direct\-to\-Customer e\-commerce site) and back\-end (e.g., OMS/ERP) systems.
As a Sr. Product Manager Technical, you will lead product strategy, turning customer insights and feedback into plans that accelerate delivery of the right product for merchants and shoppers. You will work directly with dedicated engineering teams and senior leadership to drive product development for developer\-facing products influencing fundamental technical design decisions, product roadmap, go\-to\-market plans and long\-term strategy.
Our ideal teammate will possess a strong product management background and have experience leading large\-scale technical products. You are naturally curious, data\-driven and entrepreneurial as you take end\-to\-end ownership for your product. You are the kind of leader who anticipates bottlenecks, deftly navigates ambiguity, makes informed trade\-off decisions and skillfully balances the needs of the business versus technical constraints. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills that help you build strong partnerships with colleagues and influence senior leaders. If you enjoy cutting through ambiguity, eliminating complexity and innovating on behalf of customers, come join us!
Key job responsibilities
\- Develop and communicate a compelling product vision and strategy.
\- Deeply understand the technology and collaborate closely with your engineering partners to support the long term technology strategy for our integration products.
\- Understand customer pain points and collaborate with engineering counterparts on the roadmap to address gaps, identify dependencies and clear blockers, balancing impact vs. engineering cost.
\- Define the success metrics for features or services to track performance, deep\-dive on issues and uncover trends and patterns.
About the team
Buy with Prime is helping people reimagine the way they shop. Our vision is to enable every entrepreneur in the world to reach every customer in the world through every channel they can imagine. Buy with Prime is a new way to extend Prime shopping benefits—including fast, free shipping, seamless checkout experience, and free returns—to merchants’ own online stores, ultimately increasing selection for Prime members. Buy with Prime is an exciting next step in our mission to help merchants of all sizes grow their business—whether on Amazon or beyond.
  

* Master's degree
* 5\+ years of technical product or program management experience
* Experience building API solutions (REST, GraphQL) for developer customers
