title: Senior Financial Analyst, Finance Operations Accounting & Analysis
description:
DESCRIPTION


Finance Operations Accounting \& Analysis (FOAA) seeks an experienced Financial Analyst in our Seattle accounting team based in WA. This role is responsible for executing operational plans to achieve our organizational objectives. This role works with and effectively influences partner teams and key stakeholders across multiple organizations. The ideal candidate demonstrates ownership and sound judgment in decisions that have financial, business, operational, or customer implications. The ideal candidate excels at problem solving, pays attention to details, and drives positive change by evaluating and streamlining existing operational and accounting processes, controls and metrics.  

  

About the team  

Finance Operations Accounting \& Analysis (FOAA) performs accounting and financial planning \& analysis services, and our primary customers are Finance Operations, Central Accounting and other Amazon Finance teams. Our vision is to create a world\-class Accounting and Finance organization that raises the controllership bar, fosters continuous improvement, builds scalable processes and intelligent tools to support financial reporting and the strategic decision\-making of our partners, and lowers the company’s cost structure. We focus on controllership and financial stewardship.  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 3\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
* 4\+ years of Accounts Receivable or Account Payable experience
* 4\+ years of applying key financial performance indicators (KPIs) to analyses experience
* 4\+ years of creating process improvements with automation and analysis experience
* 4\+ years of identifying, leading, and executing opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes experience
* Bachelor's degree in engineering, statistics or business, or Bachelor's degree and 5\+ years of quantitative role (engineering, process re\-engineering, quality assurance) experience
* Six Sigma Black Belt
* Experience with advanced use of SQL for data mining and business intelligence
* Experience as a lean sensei, or experience working as a Quality Assurance Engineer

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 4\+ years of participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results experience
* MBA, or CPA
* Knowledge of Tableau
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

title: Production Coordinator - 2nd Shift, Project Kuiper Environmental Test
description:
DESCRIPTION


Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.  

  

We are hiring a Production Coordinator that will streamline the movement of parts between departments, areas, processes, and systems and be a creator of the systems necessary to minimize overhead, reduce non\-value\-add processes, improve on\-time delivery of product to downstream customers, and invent methods for flexible but efficient production.  

  

This will require a knowledgeable person of many aspects of aerospace production, including traceability, demand planning, flexible but efficient change management, broad aerospace assembly, testing, and handling requirements, application of six sigma and lean methodologies while enabling faster design changes and improvements and reducing the need for reviews, approvals, and manual interactions.  

  

\*\*\*Expected Working Hours\*\*\* Sun\-Wed (4/10s) 4:00 pm \- 2:30 am  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Work cross functionally to develop and improve production scheduling tools and WIP tracking.
* Develop processes/strategies to handle work order material discrepancies within production cells.
* Coordinate the schedule, plan, and initial staging of material/kits to all vital areas of production and test.
* Monitor, track, and move parts as required through the production flow to ensure timely delivery to next production location.
* Coordinate physical movement of parts from warehouse through production resources.
* Ensure parts are handled and protected properly.
* Work with the planning to resolve immediate floor shortages on work orders.
* Work with planning and production personnel to maintain floor stock inventory as required
* Move parts electronically through the MES system at transaction points
* Work with production personnel to ensure schedule/metric goals are understood.
* Support logistics process through innovative staging of workflow as required.
* Support management of material certifications as required – prevent use of un\-certified materials.
* Support production and inventory personnel with “return to stock” and inventory purge actions.
* Support assigned production cells with work order management activities as required.
* Communicate part status and estimated completion dates to leadership weekly.
* Assist production leadership and project teams with action item updates as required.
* Develop and maintain reports to highlight needs, deliverables and constraints as required for internal and customer use.

  

Export Control Requirement:  

Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.  

  

A day in the life  

The Production Coordinator role is critical to streamlining part movement throughout the factory. This includes the monitoring of the factory operation and addressing logistical problems inside the factory.  

  

This means regularly interacting with warehouse and logistics teams when parts are missing, late, or blocked, both physically and electronically, and then permanently solving the root cause.  

  

This includes interfacing with the test lab for staging/queuing of products with specific focus on improved flexibility of operation while minimizing non\-value add communication and operation.  

  

It also entails constantly reducing "red tape" and overhead needed to maintain and improve quality, requiring work with automation, quality, enterprise technology, and manufacturing teams.  

  

About the team  

This is a fast\-paced, intellectually challenging position, and you’ll work with leaders in multiple technology areas. You’ll have relentlessly high standards for yourself and everyone you work with, and you’ll be constantly looking for ways to remove non\-value\-add operations, reduce down\-time, improve quality of the products, and reduce lead\-time of builds and tests. We want individuals who are ready for this challenge and want to reach beyond what is possible today.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 2\+ years of industry work experience
* High school or equivalent
* Work a flexible schedule/shift/work area, including weekends, nights, and/or holidays
* 1\+ years experience with MRP/ERP systems

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* 5\+ years of experience handling parts in a manufacturing setting
* Strong computer skills, familiar with SAP ERP/MES and the full suite of MS Office products.
* Bachelor’s degree.
* Experience in organizing files and documents.
* Inventory experience.
* Experience in aerospace, military, automotive, semiconductor, or electronic manufacturing environments.
* SQL and Tableau experience.
* APICS certification.

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

title: Software Development Engineer II, Global Logistics
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
  

Join Amazon's Global Logistics Technology team and help revolutionize international shipping! As a Software Development Engineer II, you'll tackle complex challenges in cross\-border transportation, optimizing millions of packages' journeys across the globe. Your innovative solutions will directly impact customers, sellers, and operations worldwide, ensuring efficient and cost\-effective delivery of international shipments.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Design and develop highly available, scalable distributed systems

  

* Optimize complex logistics networks to maximize shipment efficiency and minimize costs

  

* Create innovative solutions for international commerce and customs constraints

  

* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to improve customer delivery options

  

* Contribute to the architecture and direction of import and export logistics technology

  

A day in the life  

In this role, you will work on challenging projects that involve developing and optimizing complex systems for global logistics operations. You will collaborate with cross\-functional teams, including Product Managers, Program Managers, Supply Chain Managers, Strategists, Analysts, and Operations Managers, to build a global network that improves speed, reduces costs, and brings selection closer to customers.  

  

About the team  

Our Global Logistics Technology team is passionate about simplifying complex problems and enhancing the experience for sellers, buyers, and operations. We're building software at an unprecedented scale, touching every international package that Amazon handles. Our focus on continuous learning, innovation, and quality drives us to develop best\-in\-class solutions. We offer a supportive environment that encourages professional growth, creativity, and teamwork.  

  

Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full\-time employees include:
  

1\. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
  

2\. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
  

3\. Paid Time Off (PTO)
  

4\. 401(k) Plan
  

Learn more about our benefits here: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/internal/benefits/us\-benefits\-and\-stock
  

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

title: Senior Product Manager, Amazon Customer Service
description:
\- Bachelor's degree or equivalent
\- 5\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience as a product manager or owner
\- Experience owning technology products
  

Are you someone who cares about customer experience, and wants to be able to see the impact of your products on customers? Can you envision a time when the experience is so good that service isn't necessary? Then we're looking for you!
We’re looking for someone to define and deliver the plan that changes how we bring simple, relevant solutions to customers who need help with their device or digital experience \- from a simple "how to" question to a complex technical troubleshooting problem. As Senior Product Manager, you thrive in an entrepreneurial, highly ambiguous, and cross\-functional environment. You possess a successful product management and business strategy background. You have experience in developing collaborative relationships and influencing individuals and teams. You place the customer at the center of your product strategy, and leverage data\-driven analyses and insights to make decisions.
Candidates for this role have a track record of moving seamlessly between defining an ambitious, customer\-centric, north star vision and working tactically to test, iterate, and deliver the right solutions. They ground their product vision in research, experimentation, and data analysis. They have strong business acumen, analytical skills, and comfort working with large, complex data sets. They are persistent in seeking answers to hard problems and developing multifaceted solutions. They balance being scrappy and frugal with maintaining highest standards and scalability.
Key job responsibilities
\- Manage the lifecycle of a product with considerable impact to the self\-service customer service strategy across more than 40 apps and devices.
\- Define the customer problem, the experience they need, and the long\-term strategy, including PRFAQ(s), three\-year plan, and product / business requirements.
\- Define product success metrics and business goals, and deliver regular product reporting to leadership and stakeholders; contribute to regular\-cadence business reviews with senior leadership.
\- Oversee product development, driving priorities with engineering, science, QA, UX, research, and more, from ideation and requirements through to launch.
\- Prioritize and manage the product roadmap and backlog, balancing short\- and long\-term goals. 
\- Use data (quantitative and qualitative), including A/B testing, to measure impact, make difficult tradeoffs, and drive strategic decisions. 
\- Identify risks and dependencies and develop mitigation strategies.
\- Influence senior leaders across Amazon Customer Service, Devices \& Services, and Global Media \& Entertainment.
\- Clearly communicate requirements from large and diverse sets of customers, to drive technical priorities, and the business strategy.
A day in the life
We thrive on solving challenging problems to innovate for our customers. By pushing the boundaries of technology, we create unparalleled experiences that enable us to rapidly adapt in a dynamic environment. 
If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!
Benefits Summary:
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full\-time employees include:
1\. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2\. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3\. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4\. 401(k) Plan
About the team
Amazon revolutionized customer service, now we are changing what customers expect from technical support. We’re responsible for the Customer Service operations and solutions for all Amazon Devices and Digital properties, from the Kindle and Echo, to Amazon Music and Prime Video. In this role you will support millions of customers, across many dynamic Amazon businesses.
  

* Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights
* Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders

title: Principal Program Manager, StoreGen
description:
\- 7\+ years of working cross functionally with tech and non\-tech teams experience
\- 7\+ years of program or project management experience
\- 7\+ years of managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership experience
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience implementing repeatable processes and driving automation or standardization
\- Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
  

The StoreGen Principal Program Manager leads Amazon's transformation toward AI\-driven software development practices by orchestrating experimentation strategies across internal teams and third\-party AI partnerships. This role is central to achieving our goal to drive step changes in software developer efficiency through AI\-native development practices. The Principal Program Manager will drive the evolution toward AI\-native development practices across Amazon teams, developing and executing experimentation strategies that validate AI\-native approaches through closed alpha, closed beta, and limited release phases. They will create scalable processes to identify, evaluate, and integrate emerging AI technologies and tools.
A key aspect of this role is building and maintaining relationships with internal teams and external AI partners. The Program Manager will coordinate with AWS, third\-party AI providers, and internal teams to identify and leverage new AI capabilities, driving adoption of AI tools and practices across development teams. Creating feedback loops between technical teams and stakeholders to continuously improve AI implementation is crucial, as is overseeing operational processes including metrics tracking, business reviews, and business health reporting. The role also involves driving the development of AI\-native documentation and training materials. Driving strategic product communication to stakeholders at all levels is an essential part of the role.
Success in this position requires excellence in stakeholder management and cross\-team collaboration with a track record of delivering complex, multi\-team initiatives. This role will be instrumental in reshaping how Amazon develops software and achieves unprecedented development efficiency through AI\-native practices.
  

* Experience delivering projects within scope, time, budget and quality

title: Technical Program Manager, Data Center Construction Tooling
description:
\- 5\+ years of technical product or program management experience
\- Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules
\- 5\+ years of analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentations experience
\- Experience building and evaluating system\-level technical design
\- Experience developing and executing/delivering product and technical roadmaps
  

AWS Data Center Capacity Delivery (DCCD) is looking for a Technical Program Manager to develop and own a Smartsheet\-based solution to support the global DCCD organization. Responsibilities include establishing the product roadmap, tool development, and ongoing maintenance. In addition to these responsibilities, this role also has program management duties such as inventing and simplifying processes, managing program communications, onboarding and training users, and establishing training and program related documentation.
This Technical Program Manager will need to be detailed, flexible, and take strong ownership of a global user base, including system functionality and process implementation. The successful candidate will be obsessed with internal and external system user groups, responsible for scoping and driving implementation of system functionality to the global team. They will be able to work independently to prioritize, craft, and execute deliverable as well as effectively work with partner teams that impact their primary user group.
This role will sit within Data Center Capacity Delivery; however, they will be part of a larger organization that is diverse, positive, exceptionally talented, driven and responsible for the design, construction and operation of industry leading data center facilities. They will need to excel at managing multiple priorities and learning the pain points of their primary users, being able to execute system implementation effectively across subject matter experts with a broad range of disciplines and/or cultural or regional differences. The ideal candidate operates effectively in an ambiguous environment and drives structure without constraining business objectives. They have a demonstrated track record of managing multiple projects and driving them to completion. Because the person in this role will influence global team members, they will also need to be highly collaborative and able to influence without authority while also being able to work with significant autonomy.
About the team
AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying. 
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee\-led and company\-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship \& Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional. 
Work/Life Balance
We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* 5\+ years of project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management experience
* Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
* Experience defining KPI's/SLA's used to drive multi\-million dollar businesses and reporting to senior leadership
* 5\+ years of technical program management working directly with software engineering teams experience

title: Software Dev Engineer II (L5), Measurement, Ad Tech, and Data Science (MADS)
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
  

Are you passionate about Big Data and Distributed systems? Do you enjoy building new state\-of\-the\-art products at Petabyte scale? Be part of a team of world\-class engineers and industry leading experts operating one of the largest big data platforms for advertising at Amazon scale.
Key job responsibilities
We are seeking an experienced software engineer to build the next generation of systems using open source technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark and Presto and AWS services like EMR, Kinesis and DynamoDB. You will have background delivering highly distributed systems at scale, design patterns like SDKs, libraries, versioning, and a strong operational track record working with multiple teams. You will be responsible for designing and developing software products that will provide measurement and reporting to a wide set of users across all of Amazon's advertising suite across display, search, native, and video on all devices.
Candidates for this position should have strong engineering fundamentals as well as real\-world experience. You will showcase diverse architectural approaches and design patterns in your technical design. Think big and stay informed about industry standards in Ad tech space. Communicate effectively across all leadership levels verbally and in writing. Lead deep technical discussions with senior engineers, collaborating to solve challenging problems. You will be able to quickly grasp new systems and provide valuable consultation.
A day in the life
We are responsible for processing all advertising events (over tens of billions of new events per day) such as impressions, clicks and views across all Amazon products. We provide petabyte\-scale, low latency and highly available event look up services to a wide set of users within Amazon Ads. We apply the latest machine learning and big data technologies available on terabytes of data a day operating Petabyte size clusters. Our data must always be fast, enabling advertisers to optimize ad spend and allocate budgets effectively by providing accurate, actionable and timely performance metrics across all of Amazon’s advertising products.
About the team
Join our fast growing Amazon Ads team! This presents an unique opportunity to take ownership and lead significant initiatives to build innovative solutions to complex and challenging problems. You will encounter some of the toughest and most inspiring technical challenges of your career as you build petabyte\-scale services, invent new big data paradigms, and scale for extreme growth.
  

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Migration and Modernization
description:
\- 7\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
\- Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional marketing programs
\- Experience in cloud computing and/or strategic enterprise workloads
\- Proven track record of leading successful product launches
\- Experience writing detailed messaging and positioning and strategic plan
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers—including the fastest\-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—are using AWS to lower costs, become more agile, and innovate faster.
Product Marketing is responsible for developing crisp, highly differentiated, and compelling positioning and messaging for AWS and its services. We tell AWS’s most important and interesting stories to educate customers about what is possible when you migrate, modernize and build on AWS.
This role can sit in one of these USA locations only: Arlington, VA, USA \| Atlanta, GA, USA \| Boston, MA, USA \| East Palo Alto, CA, USA \| New York, NY, USA \| San Francisco, CA, USA \| Seattle, WA, USA.
Relocation offered to these locations only from within the USA only.
Key job responsibilities
As a Product Marketing Manager for Migration and Modernization on AWS, you will have the opportunity to define the value proposition for migrating to and modernizing with AWS for our customers. You will be responsible for building compelling content aligned to our services portfolio that drives awareness, preference, and adoption of AWS. You will also be responsible for scaling our messaging through key channels including the website, blog, events, campaigns and more. Working with counterparts in engineering and sales, you will help drive the promotion and adoption of new features and services targeted at customers looking to migrate and modernize applications with AWS and our partners.
You will get to work on a growing, high profile business and have a strategic impact on our business planning and growth strategy for migration and modernization with AWS.
Key job responsibilities 
• Craft \& develop compelling stories, content and tools (e.g. presentations, whitepapers, infographics, webinars, customer success stories, product videos.) that land our migration and modernization on AWS value proposition 
• Own content strategy and execution for key communication channels including website, blog, social, on\-network promotion, events, and emails 
• Work with engineering teams to distill key functionality and benefits into product marketing messages 
• Engage with customer communities to drive AWS advocacy 
• Drive successful service launches inclusive of customer benefit messaging and positioning
A day in the life
Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving awareness, consideration, adoption, revenue and growth from the largest and fastest growing small\- and mid\-market accounts to enterprise\-level customers including public sector.

About AWS

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences.

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.

We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

title: Sr UX Designer, Core Shopping, Amazon Devices
description:
\- 6\+ years of design experience
\- Have an available online portfolio
\- Experience in delivering design solutions for projects of large scope and complexity
  

The Amazon Devices Customer Insights \& UX design team seeks a thoughtful, creative, and passionate Sr UX Designer to be a part of our team as we define how Amazon Devices customers discover, learn about, purchase, and get the most value out of their devices. We are a global organization building platforms and programs to support the sale of and engagement with Amazon Devices including Fire Tablets, Kindle E\-readers, Amazon Echo products, Streaming Media Products, Home Security and Smart Home products, and more. Join our team to help us define, design, and build next\-generation shopping experiences for our customers. You'll be part of a multi\-disciplinary team of designers, researchers, and technologists that can envision, create, and execute ideas from start to end.
As Sr UX Designer, you will own the Online Shopping Experience for Amazon Devices, defining and designing interfaces across platforms (mobile, desktop) for the Amazon Device shopping experience on Amazon.com that scale. You will tackle our most difficult customer problems as they evaluate and consider Amazon Devices and work with a high degree of ambiguity, designing best\-in\-class consumer experiences (user interface designs, interaction models, prototypes, etc.) in a fast\-paced, startup\-like environment. You will work closely with product management, engineering, marketing, research, and company leaders to successfully go from early\-stage concepts to launch, and support new Amazon Device launches as new technology is released to the public. You will act as a “bar raiser” for the work deployed from the User Experience team to external and internal customers and create mechanisms, frameworks, and design systems to maintain a high bar across the User Experience team. You will be an Amazon Devices “ambassador,” driving cross\-organizational collaboration and sharing, and evangelize the UX work our team is doing to drive best practices throughout the company.
You must be responsive, flexible, and able to deal with ambiguity, stakeholder complexity, and the fluidity of emerging technologies within an open and collaborative peer environment. You will visualize experiences in the abstract and drive that vision into solid design deliverables that achieve the customer goals and business requirements.
Key job responsibilities
\- Collaborate and work cross\-functionally with design, research, product, and engineering teams from design concept to design solution, setting UX guidelines, creating assets, and aiding in bug fixes to ensure bar\-raising quality all the way to market. 
\- Create the vision for developing, communicating, and implementing the user experience and follow through with the processes and tactics to fulfill the vision.
\- Oversee close coordination with product managers to develop a shared vision and lead the process to define the experience and design to deliver on the product’s objectives.
\- Use data (metric tests, usability studies, usage data) to identify opportunities and inform decisions.
\- Create pattern libraries, templates, and tools for a variety of users on our platform.
\- Identify and utilize common patterns for mobile, desktop, and e\-commerce platforms.
\- Consider how emerging technologies can unlock new customer experiences and scale business operations.
\- Consider the internal tooling required to support front\-end customer experiences. 
\- Inspire, mentor, and lead a variety of designers on the User Experience team.
\- Work strategically with executives and team members across the organization.
\- Develop and nurture relationships across the team, Amazon, and disciplines to promote collaboration and efficiency on Amazon projects.
About the team
We are a global organization spanning market research, UX research, and UX design that leads the strategic direction, design strategy, innovation, and customer experience for the Devices shopping experience on Amazon.com and automation \& scaling tools. We execute market \& UX research that informs Device hardware, software, marketing strategies, and shopping customer experience. We design platforms and programs to support device sales and engagement in e\-commerce across shopping platforms, and execute ideas from start to end. We strongly believe in a collaborative team culture and encourage cross\-team partnership and bonding to drive innovation and maintain a safe and inclusive community.
  

* Experience acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and creating personas and journey maps
* Experience with UX design of complex workflows

title: Software Dev Engineer, Project Kuiper
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
\- Experience programming in Python
  

Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low\-latency, high\-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.
Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space based systems design.
Key job responsibilities
You should be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity and relish the idea of solving problems that haven't been solved at scale before. Along the way, we guarantee that you will learn a lot, have fun and make a positive impact on tens of millions of people.
In this role, you will:
 • Architect and build software to automate hardware test systems
 • Develop software infrastructure to support test case execution
 • Architect and build automation to support development (CI/CD)
 • Align with various stakeholders on software requirements
 • Document software requirements from users
 • Support manufacturing as well as new product development
 • Enable automated data collection, data analysis
 • Deliver end\-user documents
 • Own and execute software quality and release process
 • Work with electrical test equipment
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
A day in the life

title: Senior Product Manager - Tech, Applied AI
description:
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
\- Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
  

We are seeking a passionate, talented, and inventive Technical Product Manager to join the Applied AI team and help build industry\-leading technologies that customers will love. This team offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on the customer experience and contribute to the design, architecture, and implementation of an innovative product.
The mission of the Applied AI team is to enable organizations within Worldwide Amazon.com Stores to accelerate the adoption of AI technologies across various parts of our business.
As a member of the Applied AI team, you will push the boundaries of advanced ML and Generative AI techniques to scale the inputs for hundreds of billions of dollars of annual revenue for our eCommerce business. If you have a passion for AI technologies, a drive to innovate and a desire to make a meaningful impact, we invite you to become a valued member of our team. This is an opportunity to play a key role in transforming how a large eCommerce organization continues to grow. Apply now and be part of our journey towards revolutionizing the way businesses operate with AI.
Key job responsibilities
As a Senior Product Manager\-Technical (PM\-T) in the Applied AI team, you empathize with our customers, and identify and formulate the problems we will solve. You work backwards from our customers to create a compelling product vision and a product strategy to solve complex business problems. You own the product roadmap and prioritize features to ensure your MVPs quickly add value for our customers. You are responsible for managing the lifecycle of your products and work independently with engineers, scientists, and other stakeholders on defining, building, and delivering the right products. Your product requirements are concise, with clear, measurable success criteria. You are an effective negotiator, make smart trade\-offs without sacrificing quality, and drive appropriate schedules. You use data to influence our business strategy and technical priorities, and escalate when necessary, without damaging relationships. You keep all your stakeholders up to date on your products, upcoming capabilities, and future plans. You independently represent your products and the team, and are comfortable communicating with executives as well as with business and technical stakeholders.
A day in the life
\* Dive deep with your customers to identify and understand their painpoints.
\* Think big to build durable products that anticipate future painpoints.
\* Use your technical judgment and understanding to test assumptions.
\* Write press releases that clearly state the business case and imagine what our customers will say when they are excited when they use your products.
\* Deliver products on time with the right feature set and high quality.
\* Evangelize your products and drive adoption.
\* Think through all aspects of your products' life cycles, incl. business, technical, legal, and marketing.
\* Help others grow professionally.
  

* Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight
* Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

title: User Experience Designer, Amazon
description:
\- 3\+ years of design experience
\- 3\+ years of delivering design solutions as a UX designer or interaction designer experience
\- Have an available online portfolio
\- Experience prototyping (HTML, XHTML, JavaScript, CSS, Flash or Flash Catalyst, or Axure)
  

Are you a seasoned UX Designer, passionate about new technologies, AI, driving change through data, and using customer obsessed design processes to create innovative tools?
The Advertiser User Experience team is looking for a thoughtful and passionate UX Designer who specializes in data visualization and can leverage artificial intelligence to reimagine how advertisers understand and optimize complex advertising campaigns.
We are a diverse team building cutting\-edge tools and systems that simplify advertising analytics through intelligent visualization solutions. Our mission is to transform overwhelming campaign data into clear, actionable insights that drive advertiser success. Our group functions as a start\-up within Amazon, offering a creative, fast\-paced environment where you'll apply advanced visualization techniques to solve complex reporting challenges.
As a UX Designer focusing on data visualization, you'll design scalable systems that make complex advertising metrics accessible and meaningful. You'll create intelligent dashboards and reporting interfaces that leverage AI to surface insights automatically, reducing cognitive load and enabling faster decision\-making. Your designs will help advertisers easily understand performance patterns across massive datasets, transforming how they optimize their advertising strategies.
You will collaborate across disciplines, from initial concept development through implementation, working closely with product management, data scientists, AI specialists, user researchers, and engineering teams. Your expertise in visualizing complex data will be crucial as you tackle our most challenging advertising analytics problems, creating solutions that scale effectively across diverse advertiser needs.
In this fast\-evolving space, you'll need to balance analytical thinking with creative problem\-solving, transforming technical complexity into intuitive user experiences. You must be comfortable with ambiguity, able to navigate evolving AI capabilities, and skilled at creating visualization systems that adapt to emerging technologies. Your work will directly influence how advertisers interpret and act on their advertising performance data, ultimately driving innovation in how Amazon's advertising ecosystem delivers value.
The ideal candidate brings strong data visualization expertise, experience designing for complex information systems, and enthusiasm for exploring how artificial intelligence can enhance user understanding of multifaceted datasets.
Key job responsibilities
\* Collaborate and work closely with product management, engineering, and research from design concept to design solution, setting UX guidelines and driving cross\-team collaboration and sharing, as well as establish best practices for interaction models and user interface designs throughout the team.
\* Work in a start\-up style environment, where iteration is encouraged and design acumen is demonstrated through design end\-to\-end product ownership.
\* Communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization through excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills.
\* Earn trust with product managers to develop shared vision and use research and data to identify opportunities and inform decisions.
\* Mentor junior talent
About the team
The Demand Tech UX team envisions and delivers intuitive, intelligent experiences that enable advertisers of all sizes to achieve their business goals effortlessly. As the strategic design center for Amazon Ads, we transform complexity into clarity through customer obsession, data\-driven decisions, and intentional craftsmanship. We drive platform excellence by unifying experiences, accelerating innovation, and fostering cross\-organizational collaboration. Our commitment to swift, thoughtful execution and continuous refinement ensures we create scalable solutions that set new standards for advertising excellence while delivering consistent value to our advertisers.
  

* 2\+ years of mass\-market consumer web / mobile products experience
* Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs
* Designing data visualization user experiences

title: Senior Strategic Supply Chain Manager , Consumables Supply Chain
description:
\- 5\+ years of with Excel experience
\- Bachelor's degree, or 5\+ years of professional or military experience
\- Experience working with complex data sets
\- Experience communicating results to senior leadership
  

As a Senior Strategic Supply Chain Manager for US Pets, you will be at the forefront of strategic planning, execution, and optimization of Amazon's supply chain operations. In this influential role, you will lead high\-impact projects and collaborate cross\-functionally to drive business growth and deliver an exceptional customer experience for pet parents. This position will work to continuously optimize operational metrics by working on strategic supply chain initiatives for Pets and Consumables. The Senior Strategic Supply Chain Manager serves as a key point of contact between Retail, internal supply chain partner teams, and Vendors. The person contributes to GL\-level operational strategy, annual negotiations, and opportunities to reduce cost and waste in the supply chain.
The successful candidate must be highly organized, self\-starting, and possess strong data extraction and analytical capabilities. They must have proven successes in driving operational initiatives and demonstrate passion for the customer experience. They must be focused and thoughtful in their pursuit of results and thrive in a high energy environment where tactical and strategic activities are expected to be driven in parallel.
Strong candidates will have hands\-on operations or inventory management experience and knowledge in fundamental business principles. Candidates must demonstrate the ability to succeed in efficiently managing a large catalog selection, identifying problems/finding solutions, and building/improving processes. The ideal candidate is able to lead and influence both internal and external teams in an ambiguous environment while maintaining a customer\-centric philosophy.
Key job responsibilities
 \-Identifying and delivering end\-to\-end supply chain improvement opportunities across large cohorts of vendors
\-Monitoring, analyzing, and owning category Key Performance Indicators such as: out of stock, lead time, and confirmation rates; presenting insights, themes and trends to Senior Leadership team
\-Strategically analyzing production and delivery lead\-times, while optimizing operational excellence inputs such as EDI adoption, PO confirmations, efficient receive processes, and inventory placement
\-Spearheading initiatives to enhance cost structure and profitability, collaborating closely with partner teams to ensure successful execution
\-Leading doc\-writing for XBRs and cross\-GL Consumables supply chain initiatives
\-Taking on SMEships that impact not just Pets, but all of Consumables
About the team
Amazon Consumables is Amazon’s business group dedicated to creating shopping experiences that are helping change the way customers think about the things they purchase most frequently, including groceries, health and beauty, and products for both pets and babies. We drive business growth and innovation related to the online sale of everything from dog food to diapers to razors to raisins. Our teams ensure vast product selection and create trusted, convenient shopping experiences.
  

* Knowledge of statistics or other analytical techniques
* Experience with SQL

title: Finance Manager, AWS Finance
description:
\- 5\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, or a related analytical field (e.g., engineering, math, computer science), or Bachelor's degree and 5\+ years of quantitative role (engineering, process re\-engineering, quality assurance) experience
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a pioneer in blazing the new trails of cloud computing. AWS is a high\-growth, fast\-moving group within Amazon with a start\-up mentality where new and diverse challenges arise every day. We are a group that operates with the full backing of one of the world’s most successful web companies.
AWS Service Finance seeks a world class Finance Manager. This position works closely with senior business partners and finance professionals at all levels to drive thoughtful analysis and controllership on AWS’s products. Key responsibilities include:
\- Collaborating with business partners to build and maintain detailed cost models by product/service
\- Driving the financial planning/budgeting activities
\- Preparing and providing financial reporting including communicating future financial risks and opportunities to the business
\- Developing and standardizing financial reporting
\- Working on ad hoc financial analyses and projects
\- Regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires strong people skills
  

* MBA, or CPA
* Knowledge of SQL/ETL
* 5\+ years of identifying incomplete or inaccurate data, identifying the root cause and creating/implementing an escalation plan experience
* 5\+ years of solving complex business challenges by delivering accurate and timely financial models, analysis, and recommendations that have a proven impact on business (e.g., financial savings, operational improvements, or customer benefits) experience
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

title: EUC Specialist, AWS Solutions
description:
\- Experience in quota carrying technology field sales management or business development experience leading teams that sell to medium and large enterprise accounts 
\- Experience successfully building and executing go\-to market plans for medium and large enterprise accounts 
\- BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
\- Ability to operate with a high degree of ambiguity and in a matrixed organization
\- Industry experience selling Desktop\-as\-a\-Service (DaaS) or V Desktop Infrastructure (VDI), Application virtualization.
  

Amazon WorkSpaces, WorkSpaces Core, AppStream 2\.0, WorkSpaces Secure Browser and WorkSpaces Thin Clients make\-up the AWS managed service platform for End User computing based in the Amazon cloud. This suite enable customers to choose the optimal v desktop, secure browser, or application streaming service for your specific needs—enabling workers to be productive from any supported device, while maintaining a strong security posture, improving agility, and reducing cost. This is a unique opportunity to be part of rapidly growing business that promises to be unique in the web services arena. AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small\- and mid\-market accounts to enterprise\-level customers including public sector.
This position is part of the AWS Specialist and Partner Organization (ASP). Specialists own the end\-to\-end go\-to\-market strategy for their respective technology domains, providing the business and technical expertise to help our customers succeed. Partner teams own the strategy, recruiting, development, and growth of our key technology and consulting partners. Together they provide our customers with the expertise and scale needed to build innovative solutions for their most complex challenges.
Key job responsibilities
\- Be Customer Obsessed
\- Deliver Results: Drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis and references
\- Meet or exceed quarterly revenue targets. \- Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan
\- Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Solutions Architects, Professional Services, Executives and Partners
\- Create \& articulate compelling value propositions around the use of AWS EUC solutions
\- Accelerate customer adoption
\- Manage and maintain a robust and accurate sales pipeline of opportunities
\- Work with partners to extend reach \& drive adoption
\- Close new business and add on business from new and existing accounts, develop referrals and references accounts by building long\-term strategic relationships with key accounts
\- Coordinate and participate in regional team meetings for education and product strategies
\- Expect moderate travel
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee\-led and company\-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship \& Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve
  

* Communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with customer executives, IT management, and internal stakeholders
* Experience working with cloud computing technologies/companies
* Proven track record in creating net new demand which builds a sustainable business
* Experience managing large Enterprise customer accounts across a geographical territory.

title: Senior UX Designer, AWS Support
description:
\- 8\+ years of industry experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar design\-related role.
\- Experience acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and creating personas and journey maps.
\- Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs.
\- Bachelor's degree in design / human\-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent years of experience.
\- Professional proficiency in high\-fidelity mockup and prototyping tools such as Figma or equivalent.
\- Portfolio of work demonstrating breadth and depth in UX and visual design. This should also include approach and process.
  

We're looking for a talented, passionate User Experience Designer to help us reinvent cloud operations with AI\-powered solutions and set a new industry standard for support. The ideal candidate is comfortable with complexity and solving hard problems. They have experience in enterprise products and have strong ideation skills, holistic systems thinking, deep attention to detail, with a passion for making difficult tasks into simple delightful experiences.
Key job responsibilities
Our team is looking for high\-performing design leaders to drive both big\-picture vision and fast\-paced execution, delivering near\-term results while exploring future opportunities. In this role, this UX designer will work closely with UX Research as well as Product and Engineering partners. Collaboration and product ownership is essential, as well as being a great communicator, who can tame ambiguity and create alignment among stakeholders. In this role you will help create AI\-powered solutions for AWS customers to help simplify cloud operations and accelerate their success.
About the team
AWS Support is revolutionizing cloud operations through AI innovation, developing intelligent solutions that anticipate and resolve customer needs. We help customers adopt, optimize, and operate AWS at scale through our technology and expertise. Our team manages essential customer\-facing platforms including Personal Health Dashboard, AWS Forums, and Support Center. As a strategic partner in customers' AWS adoption journey, we drive both customer success and direct revenue growth.
  

* Experience with UX design of complex workflows
* Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills for technical and business executives internally and externally.
* Experience with design for business and engineering customers
* UX design experience across global markets.
* Experience working with enterprise design systems.
* Ability to work efficiently and demonstrate a bias for action in a fast\-paced, often ambiguous environment.
* Experience working with distributed teams.

title: UX Researcher II, AWS Support
description:
\-3\+ years conducting UX research, across a variety of development life cycle stages
\-Master’s degree and/or PhD in psychology, cognitive science, human factors, HCI or similar
\-Skilled in generative and evaluative research methods, both qualitative and quantitative
\-Excellent written communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
  

We're seeking a UX Researcher in AWS Support to help us reinvent cloud operations with AI\-powered solutions and set a new industry standard for support.
If you are passionate about developing and applying research methods to answer challenging questions, enjoy collaborating closely with a diverse set of highly skilled cross\-functional partners, and like seeing your efforts translated into real world impact, we want you on our team.
Key job responsibilities
\- Use your knowledge of behavioral science research methods and experimental design to lead research initiatives that align to and inform business strategy and goals.
\- Use your communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
\- Help product teams and leadership determine the right research questions to ask.
\- Define and execute (and, as necessary, invent) research methods appropriate to the questions at hand, including but not limited to field research, surveys, lab studies, remote testing, and A\-B tests.
\- Provide focused, insightful, and actionable findings by quickly and thoroughly analyzing a wide range of primary and secondary data types.
\- Translate insights into measurable customer experience outcomes aligned to business goals.
\- Work with design, product management, engineering, and marketing partners to develop innovative end\-to\-end solutions that address top outcomes. Iteratively design and test these solutions until outcomes are achieved or hypotheses are proven wrong.
\- Advance the development of insight\-based knowledge management frameworks used to drive decision\-making and prioritization of investments.
A day in the life
\- The successful candidate will be nimble, creative, and have a pragmatic approach to product/design user research.
\- Define and build strong heuristic user research frameworks for the design team to leverage.
\- Provide world\-class expertise to the UX Research team and raise the UX research bar with regard to mix of methods based on research questions, timeline and resourcing.
\- Work on overlapping projects, so strong organizational skills with the ability to multi\-task are critical.
About the team
AWS Support is revolutionizing cloud operations through AI innovation, developing intelligent solutions that anticipate and resolve customer needs. We help customers adopt, optimize, and operate AWS at scale through our technology and expertise. Our team manages essential customer\-facing platforms including Personal Health Dashboard, AWS Forums, and Support Center. As a strategic partner in customers' AWS adoption journey, we drive both customer success and direct revenue growth.
  

* Solid understanding of the software development cycle.
* Basic understanding of Cloud Services (AWS)
* Experience conducting research with technical audiences
* Basic understanding of AI / Generative AI technology
* Experience conducting UX research in the domain of AI/GenAI experiences

title: Material Coordinator, Warehouse, Project Kuiper
description:
• High school diploma or equivalent
• 2\+ year in supply chain, operations, warehousing, inventory control or related experience
• 1\+ year experience using Microsoft Excel to navigate and interpret data
• Able to lift up to 49 pounds
• Able to stand/walk for up to 10 hours
• Willing to work a schedule that may include weekends, nights, and/or holidays
• Work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
  

Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.
Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Candidates must be 18 years or older with the ability to understand and adhere to all job requirements and safety guidelines.
The starting pay for this role in Washington State is up to $32/hour and employees are eligible for incremental raises based on tenure. A full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits are provided. This information is provided per the Washington State Pay Transparency Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.
Key job responsibilities
• Accurately and efficiently handle material for both production and development efforts.
• Use proprietary software and ERP systems to virtually transact material.
• Document system issues, process flaws and inefficiencies. 
• Communicating with quality control, purchasing and other related departments to resolve problems.
• Efficiently move material between sites, both physically and virtually.
• Identify training needs for the team and assist in the training of new\-hires and junior peers.
• Meet safety, productivity and quality standards by following best practices.
• Resolve individual work blockers and knowing when to escalate if you are unable to resolve yourself.
• Learn new processes.
• Operate equipment including: forklifts, pallet jacks, electric pallet jacks, and hand carts.
• Contribute to the improvement of SOPs including safety procedures.
Additional requirements
• Shift schedule may vary depending on program needs and may include a weekend day. 
• Standing for long periods of time, climbing up and down ladders, bending, grasping, sitting, pulling, pushing, stooping, and stretching may be required to perform the functions of this position.
A day in the life
The Kuiper team is looking for motivated, customer\-focused individuals who want to join us as a Material Coordinator. You will be responsible for processing materials in order to support our customer, the satellite production team. You will also interact with peer teams such as planning, quality, and EHS to ensure our processes result in positive outcomes for these teams. You are a problem solver and are comfortable performing a variety of procedures and troubleshooting standard tasks.
  

* 1\+ year of ERP experience preferably with SAP
* Demonstrated problem solving skills and analytical skills
* Experience with Kaizens or other continuous improvement projects
* Demonstrated problem solving skills and analytical skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills (communication, listening, positive attitude, emotional intelligence)
* Forklift certified
* Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment and prioritize tasks
* Demonstrated commitment to safety and quality

title: Product Manager - Tech, Applied AI
description:
\- 5\+ years of customer\-facing product development and product management, including defining, launching, and optimizing product and services experience
  

We are seeking a passionate, talented, and inventive Technical Product Manager to join the Applied AI team and help build industry\-leading technologies that customers will love. This team offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on the customer experience and contribute to the design, architecture, and implementation of an innovative product.
The mission of the Applied AI team is to enable organizations within Worldwide Amazon.com Stores to accelerate the adoption of AI technologies across various parts of our business.
As a member of the Applied AI team, you will push the boundaries of advanced ML and Generative AI techniques to scale the inputs for hundreds of billions of dollars of annual revenue for our eCommerce business. If you have a passion for AI technologies, a drive to innovate and a desire to make a meaningful impact, we invite you to become a valued member of our team. This is an opportunity to play a key role in transforming how a large eCommerce organization continues to grow. Apply now and be part of our journey towards revolutionizing the way businesses operate with AI.
Key job responsibilities
As a Product Manager\-Technical (PM\-T) in the Applied AI team, you empathize with our customers, and identify and formulate the problems we will solve. You work backwards from our customers to create a compelling product vision and a product strategy to solve complex business problems. You own the product roadmap and prioritize features to ensure your MVPs quickly add value for our customers. You are responsible for managing the lifecycle of your products and work independently with engineers, scientists, and other stakeholders on defining, building, and delivering the right products. Your product requirements are concise, with clear, measurable success criteria. You are an effective negotiator, make smart trade\-offs without sacrificing quality, and drive appropriate schedules. You use data to influence our business strategy and technical priorities, and escalate when necessary, without damaging relationships. You keep all your stakeholders up to date on your products, upcoming capabilities, and future plans. You independently represent your products and the team, and are comfortable communicating with executives as well as with business and technical stakeholders.
A day in the life
\* Dive deep with your customers to identify and understand their painpoints.
\* Think big to build durable products that anticipate future painpoints.
\* Use your technical judgment and understanding to test assumptions.
\* Write press releases that clearly state the business case and imagine what our customers will say when they are excited when they use your products.
\* Deliver products on time with the right feature set and high quality.
\* Evangelize your products and drive adoption.
\* Think through all aspects of your products' life cycles, incl. business, technical, legal, and marketing.
\* Help others grow professionally.
  

* Knowledge of agile product development and life\-cycle management process
* Experience leading cross\-functional teams to deliver products and online services on tight deadlines

title: Manager, UX Design, Amazon Advertiser Experience
description:
\- 6\+ years of design experience
\- 3\+ years of leading design teams experience
\- Experience managing teams
\- Experience with a variety of design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, Visio, Axure, and Dreamweaver
  

Are you interested in shaping the future of the Amazon Advertiser experience? We're on a journey to elevate our user experience through data, using customer obsessed design processes, and tools to create and iterate on innovative advertising! In this role, you'll be leading a power house advertising design team to create new and iterate on existing product offerings.
Amazon is investing heavily in building a world\-class advertising business, and we’re responsible for defining and delivering a collection of self\-service advertising products that drive discovery and sales. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily, and we’re breaking fresh ground to create innovative global products. Because successful advertising starts with a great customer experience, our team works backwards from the shopper to meet the needs of our advertising customers.
Key job responsibilities
\- You are a role model, mentor, and motivator.
\- You bring deep expertise in UX design (frameworks, interaction models, prototypes, research). 
\- You think big, framing designs in the context of the broader customer experience, and are equally comfortable diving deep into the details.
\- You present design work to partners and executive leadership for review, feedback, and sign\-off.
\- You prioritize effectively, use data to inform your decisions, weigh the impact and tradeoffs of decisions, and seek input where needed to drive alignment.
\- You work closely with product and business partners to develop a shared vision and lead a process to define and design experiences that deliver on those shared objectives.
\- You are comfortable navigating from ambiguity to clarity, drawing upon your expertise and design process to create structure. You proactively plan ahead, look around corners, and can see the next step (even when it doesn’t exist yet).
\- You develop processes that drive quality and efficiency to help designers accomplish more than what they could otherwise.
A day in the life
The Manager of UX Design for the Amazon Advertiser Experience, will elevate the entire team. You will inspire and mentor UX practitioners and partners, leading projects throughout the planning, design, and development cycle. You are expected to think like an owner, always raise the quality of the advertiser experience, and be a relentless advocate for customers and advertisers. You will use your organization and communication skills to bring clarity to chaos, working strategically with other team leaders and team members across the organization.
About the team
As a central org, the Advertiser Design team’s charter is to act as the strategic glue across Amazon Ads. We drive coherence, scalability, and quality within the Sponsored Ads and Demand Side Platform (DSP) advertiser experiences by making connections across experience teams, and across orgs. We get ahead of the curve by generating creative concepts that look beyond our current roadmap and technical constraints, and we sometimes challenge the status quo and raise difficult questions.
  

* Experience working cross\-team and synthesize feedback and input from product management, engineering, testing, and marketing
* Experience with agile/scrum
* Experience working data visualization teams at scale
