title: Senior Delivery Consultant- GenAI/ML, AWS, Industries
description:
\- 5\+ years of cloud based solution (AWS or equivalent), system, network and operating system experience
\- Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent
\- Experience in software development with object oriented language
\- 4\+ years of experience hosting and deploying GenAI/ML solutions (e.g., for training, fine tuning, and inferences)
  

Are you looking to work at the forefront of Machine Learning and AI? Would you be excited to apply Generative AI algorithms to solve real world problems with significant impact? Machine learning (ML) has been strategic to Amazon from the early years. We are pioneers in areas such as recommendation engines, product search, eCommerce fraud detection, and large\-scale optimization of fulfillment center operations. The AWS Industries Team at AWS helps AWS customers implement Generative AI solutions and realize transformational business opportunities for AWS customers in the most strategic industry verticals. This is a team of architects, data scientists, and engineers working step\-by\-step with customers to build bespoke solutions that harness the power of generative AI.
The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
Key job responsibilities
As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
\- Designing, implementing, and building complex, scalable, and secure GenAI and ML applications and models built on AWS tailored to customer needs
\- Providing technical guidance and implementation support throughout project delivery, with a focus on using AWS AI/ML services
\- Collaborating with customer stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective model training, building, and deployment strategies
\- Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
\- Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts
About the team
About AWS:
Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture \- Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship \& Career Growth \- We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance \- We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* AWS Professional level certification
* Masters or PhD degree in computer science, or related technical, math, or scientific field
* Strong working knowledge of deep learning, machine learning and statistics
* Experience related to AWS services such as SageMaker, Bedrock, EMR, S3, OpenSearch Service, Step Functions, Lambda, and EC2
* Hands on experience with deep learning (e.g., CNN, RNN, LSTM, Transformer), machine learning, CV, GNN, or distributed training
* Strong communication skills, with attention to detail and ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non\-experts

title: Senior Supply Chain Manager, Amazon Global Logistics, Destination Operations
description:
DESCRIPTION


Join Amazon Global Logistics as a Senior Supply Chain Manager to lead the transformation of our global inbound logistics through technology optimization. You'll take end\-to\-end ownership of defining supply types and implementing technology solutions to optimize cost, speed, and reliability within our drayage network. This role offers direct impact on customer experience through collaboration with Business, Operations, Supply Chain, Product, and Finance teams.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Drive strategic initiatives to implement automation and scalable systems
* Lead prioritization of technology needs for Destination Operations
* Analyze and optimize the end\-to\-end container lifecycle process
* Develop and execute supply type strategy within the Relay program
* Create and maintain sustainable scaling mechanisms
* Conduct root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies
* Lead business reviews and communicate strategic vision
* Partner with cross\-functional teams to drive operational improvements
* Implement data\-driven solutions for efficiency enhancement

  

A day in the life  

Your day begins with reviewing operational metrics and identifying opportunities for improvement. You'll collaborate with tech teams to advance automation projects, participate in strategic planning sessions, and lead cross\-functional meetings to align on priorities. Time will be spent analyzing data to optimize supply chain processes, developing presentation materials for senior leadership, and working with various stakeholders to implement process improvements. You might end your day documenting progress on strategic initiatives or mentoring team members on project execution.  

  

About the team  

The Amazon Global Logistics team is passionate about revolutionizing how we move products across the globe. We operate in a dynamic environment where innovation and continuous improvement are core to our success. Our team combines operational excellence with technological advancement to create industry\-leading solutions. We value diverse perspectives and encourage collaboration to solve complex supply chain challenges.

Learn more about our benefits here: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/internal/benefits/us\-benefits\-and\-stock

title: Production Coordinator - 2nd Shift, Project Kuiper Environmental Test
description:
\- 2\+ years of industry work experience
\- High school or equivalent
\- Work a flexible schedule/shift/work area, including weekends, nights, and/or holidays
\- 1\+ years experience with MRP/ERP systems
  

Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.
We are hiring a Production Coordinator that will streamline the movement of parts between departments, areas, processes, and systems and be a creator of the systems necessary to minimize overhead, reduce non\-value\-add processes, improve on\-time delivery of product to downstream customers, and invent methods for flexible but efficient production.
This will require a knowledgeable person of many aspects of aerospace production, including traceability, demand planning, flexible but efficient change management, broad aerospace assembly, testing, and handling requirements, application of six sigma and lean methodologies while enabling faster design changes and improvements and reducing the need for reviews, approvals, and manual interactions.
\*\*\*Expected Working Hours\*\*\* Sun\-Wed (4/10s) 4:00 pm \- 2:30 am
Key job responsibilities
\- Work cross functionally to develop and improve production scheduling tools and WIP tracking.
\- Develop processes/strategies to handle work order material discrepancies within production cells.
\- Coordinate the schedule, plan, and initial staging of material/kits to all vital areas of production and test.
\- Monitor, track, and move parts as required through the production flow to ensure timely delivery to next production location.
\- Coordinate physical movement of parts from warehouse through production resources.
\- Ensure parts are handled and protected properly.
\- Work with the planning to resolve immediate floor shortages on work orders.
\- Work with planning and production personnel to maintain floor stock inventory as required
\- Move parts electronically through the MES system at transaction points
\- Work with production personnel to ensure schedule/metric goals are understood.
\- Support logistics process through innovative staging of workflow as required.
\- Support management of material certifications as required – prevent use of un\-certified materials.
\- Support production and inventory personnel with “return to stock” and inventory purge actions.
\- Support assigned production cells with work order management activities as required.
\- Communicate part status and estimated completion dates to leadership weekly.
\- Assist production leadership and project teams with action item updates as required.
\- Develop and maintain reports to highlight needs, deliverables and constraints as required for internal and customer use.
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
A day in the life
The Production Coordinator role is critical to streamlining part movement throughout the factory. This includes the monitoring of the factory operation and addressing logistical problems inside the factory.
This means regularly interacting with warehouse and logistics teams when parts are missing, late, or blocked, both physically and electronically, and then permanently solving the root cause.
This includes interfacing with the test lab for staging/queuing of products with specific focus on improved flexibility of operation while minimizing non\-value add communication and operation.
It also entails constantly reducing "red tape" and overhead needed to maintain and improve quality, requiring work with automation, quality, enterprise technology, and manufacturing teams.
About the team
This is a fast\-paced, intellectually challenging position, and you’ll work with leaders in multiple technology areas. You’ll have relentlessly high standards for yourself and everyone you work with, and you’ll be constantly looking for ways to remove non\-value\-add operations, reduce down\-time, improve quality of the products, and reduce lead\-time of builds and tests. We want individuals who are ready for this challenge and want to reach beyond what is possible today.
  

* 5\+ years of experience handling parts in a manufacturing setting
* Strong computer skills, familiar with SAP ERP/MES and the full suite of MS Office products.
* Bachelor’s degree.
* Experience in organizing files and documents.
* Inventory experience.
* Experience in aerospace, military, automotive, semiconductor, or electronic manufacturing environments.
* SQL and Tableau experience.
* APICS certification.

title: Software Dev Engineer, AGI Information - Knowledge Graphs
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Proven experience designing and implementing scalable, fault\-tolerant distributed systems with focus on performance, reliability, and operational excellence
  

Amazon's AGI Information is seeking an exceptional Software Engineer to drive ML systems development in the Amazon Knowledge Graph (AKG) team. AKG is re\-inventing knowledge graphs for the LLM\-era, developing sophisticated ML models and pipelines that enable efficient LLM grounding and power LLM\-based customer experiences.
We're looking for candidates who combine strong software engineering fundamentals with practical ML system development experience. You'll need to demonstrate expertise in building scalable, fault\-tolerant distributed systems, with a track record of shipping production services that handle large\-scale workloads. While ML engineering skills are important, we prioritize candidates who understand professional software engineering practices across the full development lifecycle \- from system design and coding standards to testing, deployment, and operational excellence.
Key job responsibilities
\- Design, develop and maintain ML model serving infrastructure to enable high\-throughput, low\-latency entity resolution predictions in production environments
\- Collaborate with applied scientists to productionize ML models, including implementing model improvements and new architectures for entity matching and deduplication
\- Develop efficient data processing pipelines to handle large\-scale training and inference data for entity resolution models
\- Support experimentation and A/B testing infrastructure to evaluate model improvements
\- Work closely with downstream engineering teams to integrate entity resolution capabilities into various product surfaces
\- Participate in code reviews, technical design discussions, and sprint planning to ensure high quality software delivery
\- Strong understanding of ML fundamentals and common optimization techniques
\- Experience with data processing and ETL pipelines at scale
  

* Master's degree in computer science or equivalent
* Strong background in event\-driven architectures, distributed caching, REST APIs, vector search, and data processing patterns (CDC, streaming)
* Deep experience with core AWS services including DynamoDB, ElastiCache, Lambda, S3, OpenSearch, and infrastructure\-as\-code (CDK/CloudFormation)

title: Senior Vendor Manager, Books
description:
\- 5\+ years of relevant business experience required
 \- Bachelor’s degree required
  

Do you want to be part of Amazon’s founding business and work with the world’s most influential publishers? Come join the team that started it all! The Books team is looking for an innovative, results\-oriented, customer\-centric self\-starter and team player to help grow our digital and print books business. This Vendor Manager will manage strategic relationships with publishers and help define the content strategy and execution for business initiatives and products in the US and other marketplaces around the world. The ideal candidate has solid business judgment and an analytical mind with a track record of successful negotiations, strong relationship management, and success with launching new business models, initiatives, and products. This person uses complex analytics to guide decision\-making, is able to dive deep into data and think creatively about new opportunities.
 Some key job functions of this position are:
 · Take the lead to identify, evaluate, negotiate, and manage strategic partnership deals that delight customers and support strategic objectives
 · Serve as a key member of the Content Acquisition team in defining and delivering the strategy around content acquisition, new business models, promotional programs, and growing readership around the world

 · Establish and execute against selection, operational, and business metrics
 · Deliver results by working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. product management, legal, marketing, and other Content Acquisition teams around the world)
 · Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management of Amazon and publishers
 · Identify opportunities for innovation and automation
 · Leverage data analysis to research difficult or ambiguous problems, leading cross\-disciplinary teams to drive recommendations to senior leadership
 · Develop and execute against P\&L while understanding business trends that impact the bottom line

* Ability to analyze and react to emerging trends in the marketplace
* Knowledge of SQL and other reporting technologies and methods
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
* Experience with executing deals and partnerships
* Demonstrated ability to engage and influence senior level executives
* Experience working in digital content acquisition roles or product management roles

title: Business Analyst , Production Planning Team (PPT)
description:
\- Bachelor's degree
\- 5\+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
\- 3\+ years of business or financial analysis experience
\- Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
\- Experience with Excel
\- Experience with SQL
\- Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
  

Join us in revolutionizing labor planning for Amazon's innovative fulfillment centers. As we develop a new type of facility across our North America Customer Fulfillment Network (NACF), we're seeking leaders to architect the future of workforce optimization. These new centers are designed to solve a complex challenge: ensuring customer packages are positioned as close as possible to their final destinations, dramatically improving delivery speed and efficiency.
Our Production Planning Team (PPT) is at the forefront of implementing solutions that combine advanced modeling, machine learning, and predictive analytics to create the most effective labor planning systems for these strategically located facilities. This new fulfillment center model requires a complete rethinking of our workforce approach, balancing proximity to customers with operational efficiency.
This is your opportunity to shape how Amazon approaches workforce planning in these critical, proximity\-focused facilities. We're developing innovative frameworks that will become the standard for the industry, optimizing our labor force to manage a dynamic inventory that's constantly shifting to meet local demand patterns.
We're seeking analytical minds who can translate complex logistical data into actionable workforce strategies at scale, and build robust labor plans. This high\-visibility role will directly influence how we staff and operate our newest fulfillment centers, ensuring we maintain Amazon's customer\-centric promise while pushing the boundaries of last\-mile delivery optimization.
As a pioneer in this space, you'll help design and implement the systems that will define the future of customer\-proximate fulfillment operations, making a lasting impact on Amazon's evolving network and setting new standards for rapid, efficient delivery.
Key job responsibilities
\- Work with FC and regional leadership team
\- Build the foundation and implement an innovative model for centralized labor planning across NACF. 
\- Deliver action plans for senior managers and directors, while being a trusted partner to these network leaders. 
\- Leverage central teams (i.e. S\&OP, Central Flow, Process Engineering) to drive process and operations execution improvements.
\- Use data and bias for action to work through ambiguity and deliver results.
A day in the life
 “If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!”
“Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full\-time employees include:
1\. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2\. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3\. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4\. 401(k) Plan”
  

* MBA
* 1\-2 years relevant experience in positions that require analysis and influencing stakeholders from data interpretation.
* Previous experience within a distribution center, logistics, or manufacturing environment.
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (i.e. SQL, QuickSight, Excel VBA)

title: Executive Assistant, AWS Resilience
description:
\- 5\+ years of senior level leadership support, or 3\+ years of Amazon experience
\- Experience with Microsoft Office products and applications
\- High school or equivalent diploma
  

The Amazon AWS Resilience organization seeks a collaborative and thoughtful Executive Assistant II who wants to work in a fast\-paced, exciting environment. This role provides an opportunity to support multiple senior leaders while handling confidential information with the highest level of professionalism. You will be responsible for sophisticated calendar management, driving organizational initiatives, and developing effective relationships with stakeholders across AWS.
The ideal candidate demonstrates excellent communication abilities and can work effectively with diverse teams. We value candidates who show genuine curiosity, are dedicated to creative problem\-solving, and can maintain strong attention to detail without requiring perfection.
This position offers meaningful impact through supporting AWS's critical infrastructure operations while collaborating with talented professionals across the organization.
Key job responsibilities
• Manage multiple complex executive calendars and high\-stakes scheduling requirements
• Track and drive completion of key deliverables, ensuring proactive follow\-up on pending items
• Partner with leaders to understand priorities and implement processes that enhance organizational effectiveness
• Manage group logistics and workspace planning, including team moves and reconfigurations
• Coordinate complex domestic and international travel arrangements
• Process and file expense reports while ensuring compliance with company policies
• Plan and execute team activities and events that strengthen team culture
• Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders across all organizational levels
• Anticipate and proactively address executive and team needs
• Handle confidential information with the highest level of discretion
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the administrative function
• Create and maintain documentation for key processes and procedures
• Having fun at work and helping others do the same
A day in the life
As an Executive Assistant in AWS Resilience, you'll masterfully manage complex calendars for multiple executives, coordinating sophisticated travel arrangements and organizing high\-impact meetings and events. You'll serve as a crucial liaison between senior leaders and their teams, building strong partnerships across the organization. Your role involves supporting annual planning processes, driving key deliverables to completion, and identifying process improvements to enhance efficiency. With a keen understanding of business priorities, you'll anticipate needs, solve problems proactively, and ensure smooth operations. Your meticulous attention to detail in handling expenses, logistics, and confidential information will make you an indispensable asset to the leadership team.
  

* Experience in a fast\-paced, high\-tech company
* Experience leading process improvements
* Experience designing processes to maximize efficiency

title: Corporate Counsel, NA Stores
description:
\- 5\+ years of legal experience
\- Juris Doctor and membership in one state bar or equivalent
\- Experience in transactional and technology licensing or equivalent
  

Are you an attorney passionate about shaping the future of retail? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can directly impact millions of sellers from small and medium\-sized businesses to the most well\-recognized brands? If so, we invite you to join Amazon's North America Stores legal team!
We're looking for a Business Line Counsel to serve as a strategic legal advisor to our Core Selling Partner Experience (CSPE) team. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building the most robust and seamless selling experience in retail. You'll provide end\-to\-end legal support for critical Amazon tools and experiences, including Seller Central and listing creation, directly influencing the policies and seller experiences that empower our vast network of selling partners.
This isn't just about legal advice; it's about being a strategic thought partner. You'll collaborate closely with cross\-functional business and legal teams across Amazon, providing intuitive support, educating clients on relevant regulations, and coaching them through complex legal landscapes. You'll play an integral role in developing and managing innovative solutions that connect Amazon's sellers with consumers and help them grow their businesses.
You'll also be part of a team of experienced, dynamic, and fun\-loving professionals dedicated to supporting Amazon's selling services globally. If you're ready to make a significant impact and help change the lives of business owners, we encourage you to apply!
Key job responsibilities
\- Provide end\-to\-end legal support for Amazon's Core Selling Partner Experience team, focusing on the selling partner experience across various tools and experiences like Seller Central, Listings, Catalog Protection and Brand Registry.
\- Function as a primary legal advisor and strategic thought partner to business teams, offering intuitive support and proactive guidance.
\- Identify and mitigate legal risks associated with new features, products, and services related to the selling partner experience.
\- Influence and shape policies and seller experiences to empower small and medium\-sized businesses on Amazon.
\- Take an integral role in developing, building, and managing new legal solutions that enable Amazon's sellers to connect with consumers and grow their businesses.
\- Educate and coach business clients on relevant regulations and laws impacting the selling partner ecosystem.
\- Coordinate and interact directly with cross\-functional global legal and business teams within Amazon to deliver best\-in\-class legal support.
\- Stay up\-to\-date on evolving legal and regulatory requirements relevant to retail, e\-commerce, and small business support.
  

* Experience of a mix of corporate law firm and in\-house work
* A strong ability to rapidly onboard and integrate into new teams and workflows, demonstrating quick comprehension of complex business models and legal frameworks. This includes a familiarity with the Amazon seller experience, enabling immediate contribution.
* Demonstrated skill in transforming conceptual ideas or broad tasks into concrete, structured implementation plans with clear steps, timelines, and deliverables. This encompasses the ability to apply high\-level knowledge of emerging technologies like machine learning and artificial intelligence, including large language models, to provide succinct analysis of involved legal issues in a fast\-paced, frugal environment.
* A willingness to learn and develop proficiency in common privacy\-related issues, such as training, risk assessment, and collaborating effectively with privacy SMEs to resolve complex privacy issues, including those related to biometrics.
* Willingness to learn new areas of law and business, coupled with a positive attitude towards, and even enjoyment of, contributing to potentially menial administrative tasks that are critical for maintaining organizational structure and efficiency.
* Proven ability to independently manage and prioritize a high volume of complex legal tasks, ensuring timely completion and meticulous organization. This includes experience counseling business partners and overseeing outside counsel support.
* Exceptional creativity, coupled with a meticulous attention to detail and a steadfast commitment to customer service.
* Strong analytical skills with a clear ability to systematically break down and resolve complex legal and business issues.
* Adeptness at translating intricate commercial and litigation issues into clear, actionable insights for diverse teams, including creative, technology, business, management, and other legal teams.
* Demonstrated capability to effectively coordinate international regional counsel, acting as a central intake point for business issues with global implications and ensuring systematic follow\-through.

title: Senior Product Manager - Tech
description:
\- 5\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
\- Experience managing technical products or online services
\- Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
  

The Registration and Verification team's mission is to: (a) verify the identity of every person and business selling on Amazon through the Seller lifecycle, (b) make it simple and fast for Sellers to register globally, and (c) continuously improve operations to achieve accuracy, speed, and scale. When we are successful, we build trust with our Customers and enable Marketplace growth.
We are seeking a seasoned product leader who can help us raise the bar on creating a world\-class verification experience for 3P Selling Partners who want to sell on Amazon stores. The ideal candidate must be able to influence across multiple company organizations, be an exceptionally strong communicator and analytical thinker and have a history of delivering results. This person will have solved complicated problems with elegant, simple solutions. The individual must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. High judgment, ability to influence, analytical talent, and leadership are essential to success in this role.
As a seasoned Product Manager, you will demonstrate the following skills:
 \- Product strategy and direction: Continually assess the needs of our customers and partners in defining and evolving the product and business strategy.
 \- Roadmap Planning: Deliver world\-class innovation in features, usability and product performance in a consistent cadence of releases. Be the internal and external authority and advocate for your program. Ensure consistent execution of product lifecycle processes from concept to launch, driving value\-based prioritization of product development initiatives to ensure maximum ROI.
 \- Requirements Definition: Develop comprehensive product plans incorporating customer needs, defining the competitive arena, and establishing the objectives, strategies, and actions required to achieve business goals. Produce high\-quality requirements docs and effectively prioritize and manage the scope of each product launch to deliver key capabilities on time and on budget.
 \- Work with the tech teams to craft business requirement documents, influence design and architecture of technical solutions
Key job responsibilities
\- Collaborate with multiple teams to define the strategy, vision, and features for an upcoming product launch
\- Own the product backlog and the Business Requirements Document, determine the prioritization and make feature trade\-offs 
\- Deliver the product by working with a wide set of cross\-functional teams including Engineering, Legal, Information Security, UX Designers.
  

* Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight
* Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

title: Sr SE/TPM – Cross-Cutting, Central Technical Program Management
description:
5\+ years of software, hardware, system integration and test development of complex systems across the full product life cycle – concept to production.
3\+ years in a technical lead, systems engineer, or technical program management role with significant hardware and software integration.
Proficiency with at least one schedule tracking tools such as MS Project, SmartSheet or alternative.
  

Project Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.
Innovation lies at the core of our organization's mission. We are seeking talented individuals eager to contribute to an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space and ground\-based systems. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to engage in continual learning and skills development while being part of a team whose work positively impacts the lives of millions worldwide. We foster an environment that values creativity, diligence, and the collective pursuit of technical excellence.
We are seeking a Senior Interdisciplinary Systems Engineer (ISE) / Technical Program Manager (TPM) to lead cross\-cutting programs at Kuiper. Cross\-cutting programs are interdisciplinary and span across numerous Kuiper departments. Cross\-cutting programs ensure the broader program stays connected and operates as seamlessly as possible. Examples can include requirements definition of future generation systems, block upgrades to improve existing satellite designs, or mitigation of cross\-functional risks. The Cross\-Cutting Sr SE/TPM is expected to have solid technical and program management skills, and highly adaptable to meet the dynamic needs of the broader Kuiper program. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day and have the opportunity to work with multiple technical teams at Amazon in different locations. You should be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity and relish the idea of solving problems that haven't been solved at scale before. Along the way, we guarantee that you will learn a lot, have fun, and make a positive impact on the world.
Key job responsibilities
This position requires a technical and program management background with direct experience developing relevant systems. A Senior SE/TPM anticipates bottlenecks, uses great judgment to make trade\-offs, and balances the business needs with technical constraints. Your ability to understand the big picture of the project design and anticipate and plan dependencies is crucial. Your ability to take large, complex projects, break them into manageable pieces, and deliver timely results is invaluable. You will work with a team of experts and drive the team to successfully accomplish the following activities:
• Perform Technical Program Management of highly cross\-functional programs 
• Collaborate with engineers and engineering leaders to create project execution plans with detailed dependencies.
• Optimize the velocity of engineering development through the design and application of mechanisms. 
• Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities.
• Work with engineering and program management leads to ensure that the systems development meets schedule, cost, and quality requirements. 
• Drive project execution, make technical trade\-off recommendations, understand the technical challenges, enable solutions, track and report on status, and resolve blocking issues. 
• Adhere to Program Management practices for the team including risk management, requirements management, verification and validation.
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
  

* Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Hands\-on working experience in spacecraft systems for all different phases of missions: initial design, development, test, delivery, launch and operation.
* Experience managing projects across cross functional teams and building scalable processes
* Excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, with ability to work successfully across all engineering disciplines.
* Ability to show judgment and lead and influence others.
* Independently driven, resourceful, and able to deliver results with minimal direction.
* Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with engineers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
* High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non\-technical individuals.
* Track record for being detail\-oriented.

title: Data Engineer, GTMO Product Tech
description:
\- 5\+ years of data engineering experience
\- Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
\- Experience with SQL
\- Experience in at least one modern scripting or programming language, such as Python, Java, Scala, or NodeJS
\- Experience mentoring team members on best practices
  

Over the past 20 years, Amazon has reinvented on behalf of the consumer and has become one of the largest internet retailers in the world. Amazon is now reinventing on behalf of the business customer and is building the most innovative Business\-to\-Business (B2B) online store in the world.
At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.
Amazon Business Team is looking for a Data Engineer to play a significant role in building a large\-scale, high\-volume, high\-performance data integration and delivery services. These data solutions would be used in reporting and to drive business decision making while dealing efficiently with the massive scale of data available through our Data Warehouse as well as our software systems. You will be responsible for designing and implementing solutions using third\-party and in\-house reporting tools, modelling metadata, building reports and dashboards, integrating data across disparate \& distributed systems and administering the platform software. You are expected to analyze challenging Business Problems and build efficient, flexible, extensible, and scalable data models, ETL designs and data integration services. You will also have an opportunity to build/maintain/enhance small to mid\-size custom built Applications using Python/Java. You are required to support and manage growth of these data solutions. You must be a self\-starter and be able to learn on the go. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required as you will work very closely with diverse teams.
As a Data Engineer in Amazon Business team, you will be working in one of the world's largest cloud\-based data lakes. You should be skilled in the architecture of Enterprise data warehouse solutions using multiple platforms (EMR, RDBMS, Columnar, Cloud). You should have extensive experience in the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and to build data sets that answer those questions. Above all you should be passionate about working with huge data sets and someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions and drive change.
  

* Experience with big data technologies such as: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, EMR
* Experience operating large data warehouses

title: Senior Financial Analyst, AWS SMGS FP&A
description:
\- Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or related field, or Bachelor's degree and 3\+ years of finance or a related analytical field experience
\- 3\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) seeks a Sr. Financial Analyst (SFA) to be a key member in our AWS Sales, Marketing \& Global Services (SMGS) FP\&A team. This is an exciting opportunity to join one of our fastest growing business divisions within Amazon. As an SFA, you will work closely with finance leaders to develop financial models and analytical insights to assist in evaluating new business concepts, turning insights into operational measurements \& actions, and identifying paths to improve overall planning and forecasting process.
Key job responsibilities
Key job responsibilities:
• Develop top\-line revenue forecasts in collaboration with key stakeholders 
• Create, improve, and maintain financial metrics, reports and scorecards used for consolidation reports.
• Collect, analyze and manage quantitative data to create meaningful analyses and models that drive business decisions.
• Lead processes to facilitate consolidation process and reports.
• Partner with finance technology and BI team to streamline reporting infrastructure and automation
• Lead month end close deep dives and consolidations
A day in the life
9:00 AM \- 12:00 PM
 Check emails and financial reporting deadlines
 Review calendar for key meetings
 Quick scan of any urgent business unit requests
 Monthly business review preparation
 Analyze revenue and discount trends
 Review variance explanations
 Attend an all\-hands meeting
 Forecasting and planning activities
 Update financial models
 Review assumptions with business partners
12:00 PM \- 1:00 PM
 Lunch break \& take care of personal matters
1:00 PM \- 4:00 PM
 Financial analysis projects
 Discount optimization analysis
 ROI calculations for new initiatives
 Ad hoc analysis requests from leadership
4:00 PM \- 5:00 PM
 Prep for next day
 Document outstanding items
 Review upcoming deadlines
 Update task list
Key Takeaways:
 Heavy focus on financial modeling and analysis
 Regular interaction with business partners
 Balance of recurring reports and ad\-hoc analysis
 Emphasis on data accuracy and attention to detail
 Need to understand AWS services and business model
 Participation in monthly/quarterly close process
  

* 4\+ years of participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results experience
* MBA, or CPA
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

title: Manager, RF Hardware, Project Kuiper
description:
• Bachelor's degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, or related discipline, or 7\+ years of equivalent relevant experience
• 3\+ years of managing direct reports
• Experience coordinating amongst diverse disciplines (software, production, reliability) to drive full\-lifecycle system development
• Experience with RF/ microwave design expertise in Power, Low Noise and Driver Amplifier design for commercial or military communications receivers, transmitters and sub\-systems up to V\-band.
• Experience with analog, digital and mixed mode circuit design and layout.
• Ability to plan, direct, and manage project work.
• Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
• Excellent math aptitude, written and communication skills.
• Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment.
  

Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low\-latency, high\-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.
Come work at Amazon!
As the lead, you will own the successful delivery of the satellite RF transceiver hardware into the overall Kuiper program. Consequently, you will work with senior management and program management to plan, schedule, and execute delivery of various subsystems. This position requires a technical understanding of RF/microwave circuitry and communication systems theory. Must be able to work effectively cross\-functionally with multiple disciplines. 
In this role you will: 
• Lead a team of RF engineers to develop, qualify, and produce millimeter\-wave high performance space flight hardware
• Drive hardware designs forward and ensure successful release
• Own delivery of subsystems to various internal customers and sustain the delivered hardware
• Manage inter\-dependencies with other teams to ensure tight alignment for successful subsystem deliveries.
• Work with test team to ensure automation and test execution is ready and available for use.
• Identify issues and gaps and drive them to closure.
• Provide clear and concise reporting to upper management.
• Organize, plan, and execute hardware bring\-up, DVT, qualification, and reliability campaigns.
• Lead hardware and software integration efforts.
• Derive RF HW specifications for the RF system and RF blocks
• Evaluate systems and directs design modifications.
• Be responsible for generating, reviewing and implementing engineering change orders.
• Troubleshoot and repairs circuits and fixtures.
• Establish and maintain support schedules and response protocols for RF transceiver systems, ensuring continuous technical coverage during manufacturing, satellite testing, and on\-orbit operations.
Export Control Requirement: 
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Key job responsibilities
• Will work cross\-functionally on collaboration to fluently engage with diverse engineering disciplines, effectively advocate for RF system requirements, and ensure alignment for overall system success.
• Lead the team in the design of high performance Ka\-Band, Q\-Band, and V\-band frequency converters, LNAs and SSPAs. 
• Develop Microwave and millimeter wave RF hardware requirements and end to and system test plans.
• Works closely with the cross\-functional organizations to define DVT, Qualification, reliability and production test requirements
• Develop, designs, and test of high\-power RF/microwave components, subsystems and systems.
• Derive RF HW specifications for the RF system and RF blocks/circuits
• Performs root cause analysis on products, technical problems, processes and documentation.
• Assess feasibility of various designs in support of architectural definition
• Participate in subsystem design and prototyping, schematic capture, prototype bring\-up and debugging, hardware bug tracking, functional verification, and signal characterization
• Evaluate and characterize new technology, prototypes and RF components
• Support manufacturing engineers on production testing of RF avionics components and systems
• Coordinate schedule and cost forecasting with the project Manager and Program Manager.
• Direct design engineering personnel in the design and development.
• Evaluate systems and directs design modifications.
• Responsible for generating, reviewing and implementing engineering change orders.
• Troubleshoots and repairs circuits and fixtures.
This position is in Redmond, WA or San Diego, CA. Some travel, both domestic and international, will be required. (Up to 30%.)
This position requires ability to lift up to 20 lbs with or without reasonable accommodation.
  

* Master's degree or PhD in electrical engineering and 10 years of industry experience in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory
* Management experience of a team of RF/microwave engineers
* Experience performing analysis and simulation of communication systems including link budgets
* Thorough understanding of RF passive and active components and circuitry
* Knowledge of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, forward error correcting codes (FEC), single and multi\-carrier techniques, modulation types such as PSK, APSK, QAM, OFDM
* Understanding of electromagnetic propagation and antenna systems
* RF/microwave design using ADS, HFSS, AWR Microwave Office
* Experience with the design and integration of RF systems consisting of radio transmitters and receivers, LNAs, PAs, couplers, filters, etc.
* Experience with RF test equipment, such as spectrum analyzers and network analyzers
* Experience mentoring engineers in engineering best\-practices and domain\-specific technical principles
* Comfortable communicating deeply technical topics to a wide variety of audiences
* Ability to lead projects across departments, create and maintain project schedules, and ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget
* Technical leadership skills and communication skills, ability to create clarity across technical stakeholder and customer teams
* Working knowledge of space environments and the process to space qualify a communication flight unit.
* Familiarity with hybrid microelectronics for space applications and MIL\-PRF\-38534

title: Hardware Dev Engineer, Amazon Manufacturing Services
description:
\- 3\+ years of working in mechanical engineering or equivalent experience
\- Experience with prototyping and implementation
\- Experience in developing functional specifications, design verification plans and functional test procedures
\- Experience with prototyping and implementation
\- Demonstrated experience with CAD software (preferably SolidWorks or similar)
\- Experience with GD\&T and mechanical drawing standards
\- Understanding manufacturing processes and DFM principles
\- Ability to perform basic structural and mechanical calculations
\- Strong problem\-solving and analytical skills
\- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  

This role is for an engineer with the ability to design and develop parts and assembly for a wide range of applications within Amazon. In this role, you’ll identify the requirements through customer engagement and use your education and experience to design and build mechanisms that meet customer needs. This is a hands\-on role and requires a self\-starter with skill in electromechanical system, design, build, and testing. This role is for an engineer who will drive hardware development projects from concept through production within Amazon Manufacturing Services (AMS). The position combines hands\-on technical work with project management and customer collaboration. You'll work across multiple engineering disciplines to deliver innovative solutions that meet Amazon's high standards for quality and efficiency.
Key job responsibilities
• Design and develop mechanical and electromechanical systems using industry\-standard CAD tools
• Lead technical discussions with stakeholders to gather and refine requirements
• Create detailed engineering documentation including drawings, specifications, and test procedures 
• Perform engineering analysis including FEA, tolerance analysis, and failure mode analysis
• Develop and execute verification and validation test plans 
• Collaborate with cross\-functional teams including operations, quality, and procurement
• Manage 2\-3 concurrent projects with varying complexity levels
• Identify and analyze customer requirements with internal Amazon teams that have impact on the customer’s business 
• Document part, assembly or product design requirements and attain customer approval to reduce product ambiguity
• Ability to work with intermittent management guidance to complete defined tasks
• Produce complete design packages – CAD detailed drawings, analysis reports, BOMs, Assembly documentation.
• Oversee production requests and give guidance to operations staff to ensure on time delivery
• Execute manual assembly of first articles and complete functional tests to confirm performance
• Facilitate cost trades and design revisions on multiple parallel configurations for cost or manufacturability improvements
• Create final product documentation including test results and user manuals
• Deliver newly designed products and attain customer final approval
About the team
Amazon Manufacturing Services (AMS) is an internal manufacturing service provided by Amazon to support its engineering and product development needs. AMS offers a range of manufacturing capabilities including additive manufacturing (3D printing), subtractive manufacturing (CNC machining, waterjet cutting, sheet metal bending), and design engineering services.
  

* Experience working with interdisciplinary teams to execute product design from concept to production
* Experience with the project management techniques for technical projects
* Hands on experience using multiple manufacturing modalities such as 3D Printing, 2D cutting, CNC machining and sheet metal forming
* Proficiency in advanced CAD software and finite element\-based simulation
* Experience creating circuit diagrams
* Experience in basic programing for system controls, such as Python or G\-Code

title: Senior Product Manager Tech, Prime Video
description:
\- 5\+ years of technical product or program management experience
\- 2\+ years of end to end product delivery experience
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience managing technical products or online services
\- Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive\-level prioritization and planning
  

Prime Video is shaping the future of global digital video entertainment. Our vision is to delight streamers by offering the freshest, richest, and most defect\-free catalog of content anywhere. We are looking for a data\-savvy, strategic, and analytical Senior Product Manager to work on the content licensing technology of our supply chain. In this cross\-functional role you will help define and execute the strategy for the products and services that drive defect and on time delivery of high quality video content to customers. You will collaborate with data science, engineering, operations, other product managers, and executive teams to bring products to market, develop and grow business opportunities, and enhance our platform capabilities.
The duties will include formulating a business vision for your product domain, gathering business and functional requirements from internal customers and end\-users, and translating those requirements into technical specifications to build robust, scalable, and supportable solutions that work well with a range of complex systems. The PMT serves as the technical as well as the business lead throughout the entire development lifecycle including scoping, planning, conceptualizing, designing, testing, documenting, and shipping the product to the end customer keeping in mind issues around tech debt, scalability, performance and latency, and compatibility with technology and business goals.
Key job responsibilities
\- Define and execute toward the long\-term strategy for the digital supply chain
\- Work closely with data science and engineering teams to prioritize and deliver the roadmap
\- Working closely with Business Intelligence to analyze business trends and make data\-backed decisions
\- Collaborate with cross\-functional teams including other product managers, partner management, and leadership to influence and drive the long\-term strategy
\- Create business requirements, develop solutions, and socialize them across functions and teams
\- Own the end\-to\-end product lifecycle
This position may be located in Seattle or Los Angeles.
If you enjoy defining and delivering first\-class customer experiences, working with data science and tech teams, and have a passion for video, come join us!
About the team
Our vision is to be the world’s most reliable, fastest digital video catalog. We provide partners with the best way to distribute their content and streaming customers with a consistent, reliable experience that works in any device, anywhere.
Our team:
\- Is obsessed with making things work for the streaming customer and the content partner
\- Makes data\-backed decisions
\- Encourages continuous growing by supporting each together
\- Builds trust across our organization through transparency and communication
  

* Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight
* Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

title: Business Analyst, Listing Analytics
description:
\- 3\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- 5\+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
\- 3\+ years of business or financial analysis experience
\- Bachelor's degree or equivalent
\- Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
\- Experience with Excel
\- Experience with SQL
\- Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
  

Are you looking for a role that allows you to shape the future of how sellers sell their products globally with Amazon? Do you like working in a start\-up like environment with the opportunity to have a significant impact from day 1? Do you have an insatiable curiosity about why Amazon global stores operate as they do and how Amazon could optimize its global selling business? If so, then keep reading as this could be the role for you.
Over 2MM active sellers in 22 countries (and growing) list their products for sale on the Amazon stores. Sellers are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the earth’s largest selection and lowest prices.
Key job responsibilities
As a Business Analyst on Listing Analytics team, you will be responsible for bringing data to the table, specifically seller anecdotes and business metrics. The ideal candidate thrives in working in large and complex data warehouse environments, has excellent verbal and written communication skills, is motivated by developing innovative and simplified solutions to solve complex analytical problems and is passionate about working with large data sets and bringing data together to answer business questions and drive change. These analyses and solutions will be fundamental to finding opportunities and creating new programs aimed at further growing on Amazon stores. In this role you will:
• Engage with leadership and diversified customer groups to understand the needs and recommend business intelligence solutions.
• Partner with engineering teams to define the data elements and data structures that the team should leverage to develop critical seller experience metrics.
• Design, implement, and support platforms that provide business teams ad\-hoc access to large datasets for self service deep dives (eg: data visualization tools for non\-tech business users)
• Interface with business customers, gather requirements and deliver complete reporting solutions.
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
• Participate in strategic \& tactical planning discussions
• Standardize data and report consumption across all customer groups.
• Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve the operational and quality metrics.
• Be connected and influential within the Amazon analytics community. Work with business intelligence engineer, data engineering, software development teams to enable the appropriate capture and storage of key data points.
  

* Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
* Master's degree in business or analytical discipline
* Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large\-scale, complex datasets

title: Finance Manager - DBS, AWS Database Finance
description:
\- 5\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, or a related analytical field (e.g., engineering, math, computer science), or Bachelor's degree and 5\+ years of quantitative role (engineering, process re\-engineering, quality assurance) experience
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a Finance Manager to be a key member of the AWS Database team. This role will own end to end finance support including P\&L management and planning for Database services. Additionally, this role will drive strategic new Database feature launches and process improvements across the organization. The successful candidate will be able to communicate effectively, manage multiple and time sensitive deliverables across a highly matrixed organization, along with managing risks and opportunities. The individual will also possess strong business partnership skills and collaborate effectively with key stakeholders.
Key job responsibilities
1\. Take the lead in financial planning; build complex financial models and analytical tools to measure overall financial performance
2\. Owning the Database services end to end of revenue creation, and influence business decisions that drive pipeline creation and realization
3\. Identify opportunities for efficiency improvements including automation and coordination with upstream and downstream organizations
4\. Partner with finance, business, and sales teams across AWS to standardize, streamline, and prioritize improvements, remove roadblocks, and increase the reliability and efficiency of reporting.
  

* 5\+ years of identifying incomplete or inaccurate data, identifying the root cause and creating/implementing an escalation plan experience
* 5\+ years of solving complex business challenges by delivering accurate and timely financial models, analysis, and recommendations that have a proven impact on business (e.g., financial savings, operational improvements, or customer benefits) experience
* MBA, or CPA
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)
* Experience delivering forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis, and data interpretation of results
* Knowledge of SQL/ETL
* Experience performing ad hoc analysis using advanced Excel

title: Product Marketing Manager, Amazon Business
description:
\- 2\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
\- Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
\- Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
\- Experience building, executing and scaling cross\-functional programs or marketing campaigns from concept to completion
\- Experience managing and measuring marketing performance in various channels
  

Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $35 billion global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space, developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination, and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.
This role is part of the Amazon Business WW Marketing team and our vision is to establish Amazon Business as the most recognized B2B brand. In this role, you will lead the strategy and production of engaging onsite experiences, and champion event production across cross\-functional teams. This includes merchandising events and seasonal promotions globally on Amazon Business. This role will need to communicate regularly with senior leadership and be responsible for driving top\-level business goals.
To be successful in this role, this individual will work seamlessly with senior stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Category, Selection, Pricing, and Tech across geographic regions to optimize through scale and continuous experimentation. We are looking for an individual with broad experience in online merchandising, digital marketing, and product marketing. This role requires skills in strategic thinking, relationship building, and problem solving, as well as a willingness to be hands\-on with execution.
The ideal candidate has a track record of success in delivering results at scale and working cross\-functionally across multiple teams and countries. The individual will thrive in a fast\-paced, high\-pressure entrepreneurial environment. If you’re looking to join a dynamic, growing team in a high\-impact role, this is a great fit for you.
Key job responsibilities
· Own WW strategy and production of onsite events and seasonal promotions (e.g., Back to School, Black Friday) on Amazon Business
· Deliver multi\-channel marketing campaigns and engaging onsite experiences for B2B customers
· Develop detailed campaign project plans, creative briefs, and digital strategies, including campaign goals, messaging, calls to action, segmentation strategy, marketing distribution channels, and campaign schedule
· Apply key insights into business actions and push for new ways to achieve objectives at scale
· Define business metrics, measurement plan, and testing plan for site\-event events
· Work at both the strategic and tactical level to champion bold, creative ideas
· Test and refine new marketing approaches and channels to reach and engage key audiences
· Create and maintain scalable, repeatable methods of measurement and performance tracking for campaigns
· Manage multiple projects gracefully and balancing contending priorities in a rapidly changing environment
  

* 4\+ years of professional non\-internship marketing experience
* Experience managing external partners to develop marketing programs
* Experience presenting ideas to various levels of an organization to gain support for initiatives

title: Sr. Manager, Finance Operations Accounting, Payroll
description:
\- Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or related field
\- 12\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- 10\+ years of positions that require analysis and reporting financial results experience
\- 8\+ years of Accounts Receivable or Account Payable experience
\- 7\+ years of directly managing and leading a team of 10\+ members experience
  

Amazon seeks an experienced Senior Manager to be the Global Functional Leader for Payroll on the Finance Operations Accounting \& Analysis (FOAA) team. Finance Operations enables and accelerates Amazon’s growth by improving the vendor and seller experience through automation and innovative process improvements that simplify doing business with Amazon and that enable lower prices and greater selection for our customers. This position is the key partner for Global Payroll senior leadership and will partner with Global Operations and Accounting teams to identify areas of controllership risk, compliance risk, and related financial accounting impact. The ideal candidate is a highly proactive self\-starter with a strong operational and accounting background, problem solving skills and attention to detail who will take ownership and drive positive change including evaluating and streamlining existing operational and accounting processes, controls and metrics. This role has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires strong interpersonal and communication skills.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
\- Set goals for the FOAA Payroll function globally 
\- Prioritize automation projects within FOAA Payroll to drive FOAA baseline savings goals 
\- Drive operational excellence by identifying business process re\-engineering opportunities and partnering with projects team to provide accounting requirements that maintain highest level of controllership 
\- Drive global reporting format standardization and set SLA’s 
\- Ensure all Central Accounting Deliverables met within SLA; analyzing account activity; validating account balances are materially correct; explaining business drivers for account balance fluctuations 
\- Influencing business decisions with effective verbal and written communication, data driven analysis and presentation of alternatives 
\- Facilitate financial review meetings with FinOps leadership, including design and review of internal financial reports 
\- Raise the bar on hiring, developing, and retaining the best talent to continue building our world class team of finance professionals
  

* 5\+ years of hiring, leading and developing teams experience
* 8\+ years of participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results experience
* 8\+ years of identifying incomplete or inaccurate data, identifying the root cause and creating/implementing an escalation plan experience
* 8\+ years of mentoring junior finance and/or business team members experience
* 5\+ years of working with senior staff (e.g. c\-suite) experience
* MBA, or CPA

title: Business Intelligence Engineer, NACP Analytics
description:
\- 3\+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
\- Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
\- Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
\- Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
\- Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
  

Are you excited to drive high\-visibility, strategic Analytics solutions to help streamline Amazon's capacity planning? NACP \- Analytics \& Science is seeking an experienced Senior BIE, to lead the business analytics, science \& automation in partnership with Data Scientists, Supply Chain leaders and Engineers. Our mission is to simplify analytics with innovative Data/Science products.
This role is for a motivated individual with strong analytical, technical background to join us as Senior BIE. You will be responsible for designing and supporting best\-in\-class business analytics solutions and help leadership make impactful business decisions. You will own the design, development of analytics \& science solutions to support key Capacity Planning initiatives. You will continue to raise the bar for creating scalable, efficient , automated processes for large\-scale data analysis.
Key job responsibilities
\- Partner extensively with Capacity Planning leaders and Supply Chain Planners proactively identify analytical needs, translate them to BIE/Science solution designs
\- Design, develop, test solutions to ensure data management processes, visualization outputs are accurately representing the business insights
\- Develop best practice to reduce coding effort by reuse where applicable; replace complex data handling steps with innovative design and simpler tools/utilities
\- Work backwards from business KPIs used in operational decisions to design predictive science\-based automation solutions
\- Use AWS S3, Redshift, Athena, Quicksight, Tableau, LLM to produce reliable solutions. Enable seamless integration between BIE solutions and Strategic Planning, Excel models
\- Mentor BIEs on the team. Partner with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Product Managers to identify innovation opportunities and scale solutions
A day in the life
Successful candidate is a self\-starter, comfortable with highly ambiguous opportunities and capable of working in a fast\-paced environment with strong attention to detail.
They collaborate directly with customers (Sr. Manager, Principal Supply Chain Managers and Principal PMTs) to translate business issues to technical opportunity statements/requirements along with design concepts.
They collaborate cross functionally inspiring peers and stakeholders to adopt highest quality solutions and simplify processes.
About the team
NACP (North America Capacity Planning) oversees capacity planning for Amazon warehouses and IXDs. We plan and design Amazon warehouses and influence multiple retrofit projects to improve supply chain productivity. NACP is the cornerstone for optimizing ASIN placements in Amazon FCs, which improves Cost to Serve and Delivery Speed metrics for Amazon. The NACP team plays a critical role in establishing the foundation for Amazon warehouse network for maintenance and expansion over a 1\-5 year horizon.
  

* Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
* Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large\-scale, complex datasets
