title: Principal Product Manager - Tech, Transactional Services
description:
\- 7\+ years of working as a Technical Product Manager experience
\- 5\+ years of technical (software development, network development, IT, other related) experience
  

Are you interested in helping AWS deliver ever\-stronger durability, availability and disaster recovery, performance, scalability, and cost effectiveness for our customers? Are you excited by the prospect of partnering with a vast array of AWS service teams, identifying opportunities to improve their products on these dimensions, and leading technical product definition and execution to deliver on these opportunities? Would you enjoy working with a technically deep, senior engineering team on distributed systems innovation in areas such as consensus protocols and storage? If so, this might be the role for you.
Journal is a foundational AWS service that vends and manages commit logs for a number of AWS services – from databases to storage systems to compute services and beyond. These services typically use Journal on the critical path: every write or resource creation is first written to a Journal commit log. To support this, Journal is purpose\-built to provide high durability (10\+ 9s), high availability (99\.999%), high scale (100MM writes per second and growing), low latency (microseconds matter), and cost effectiveness (cents per TiB matter).
While Journal plays a significant role across AWS today, we need to define and deliver the right forward\-looking product improvements so we can keep raising the bar in what we as AWS offer to our customers. We are looking for the right Product Management leader to helm this effort, leading Journal’s customer engagement, product strategy, feature definition, and roadmap. The successful candidate will have a track record of formulating technical product direction and delivering on it, from guiding star vision to 3\-year\-plan to detail at the API and SLA level. They will have the technical aptitude required to partner effectively with senior technologists. They will have experience driving success across a diversity of customers, including building relationships, identifying needs, and partnering on engagements.
If this sounds up your alley, we’d love to hear from you.
Key job responsibilities
The primary responsibility of the Principal Product Manager \- Technical (Principal PMT\-ES) role is to own and drive the Transactional Services area forward. You will achieve this by owning the product vision, creating the product strategy, defining the customer experience, and identifying business opportunities. You own the product lifecycle including the product roadmap and feature prioritization. You are expected to contribute to engineering discussions that dive deeply into how a product solution or experience is designed and constructed. As the product manager in a deeply technical area, are expected to have deep full\-stack technical knowledge and apply this knowledge to make sure service quality, performance, and elasticity of the service will scale with the customer. You also work backwards from customers and collaborate with stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for customer experience, adoption, and operational excellence while managing and optimizing for cost. You will provide clarity where there is ambiguity. You are a builder and, most importantly, you are customer\-obsessed.
Come build with us.
If you are interested, reach out to the hiring manager
https://www.linkedin.com/in/panghalvikas/
A day in the life
Given the scope and high level of ownership that a product manager has on the Transactional Services team, rarely are two days the same. You are a business owner, customer\-facing representative for the service, and point of contact for partner teams. On a weekly basis, you will be working with customers to learn about the problems they are trying to solve, analyzing service and business metrics, writing PRFAQs and pricing narratives, iterating on product decisions with the engineering team, thinking big to envision what's next, and demonstrating curiosity about different technologies, growth strategies, and industry trends.
On a daily basis, you will have a chance to work with everyone who makes products at AWS successful, including senior leadership, engineers, data scientists, content writers, and more. You will meet with customers to understand our core strengths and weaknesses. You will synthesize that feedback and other industry knowledge, with business and service data, to create strategies and test hypotheses. As someone central to the success of Transactional Services, people will look to you on a regular basis to solve problems and connect them with specialists. To develop that expertise, you will constantly be looking to learn by reaching out to other experts within the company and in the larger tech community, using your own product by developing samples, demos, and side\-projects, and engaging in mentorship opportunities. Our customers are developers and technical decision makers, so you will be using code, technical documentation, and architecture diagrams to understand problems and communicate solutions.
  

* Experience delivering large\-scale SaaS, PaaS or LaaS products where you are responsible for the full product lifecycle, from concept through GTM (go to market)

title: Advanced Production Scheduler, Project Kuiper
description:
\- 5\+ years of technical product or program management experience
\- 7\+ years of working directly with engineering teams experience
\- 3\+ years of software development experience
\- 5\+ years of technical program management working directly with software engineering teams experience
\- Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules
  

Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.
This role includes direct responsibility for program management of planning, manufacturing, integration, and test of production value stream. This is a highly technical role requiring experience with integrated hardware and software as well as some appreciation for complex applications and manufacturing systems. Candidate superpowers should include bias for action, ownership, insist on high standards, stakeholder management, innovation, creating clarity out of ambiguity, and enabling productive collaboration across different organization.
Key job responsibilities
As an Advanced Production System Scheduler, you will:
\- Develop processes/strategies to handle work order material discrepancies within production cells.
\- Coordinate the schedule, plan, and initial staging of material/kits to all vital areas of production and test.
\- Monitor, track, and move parts as required through the production flow to ensure timely delivery to next production location.
\- Own the production roadmap for production value streams that delivers the end\-to\-end solutions necessary to source, build, test and integrate satellites.
\- Drive daily execution working across supply chain, planning, fulfillment and production teams.
\- Represent the overall production roadmap in assessing technical trades related to innovation, speed, manufacturability, cost, stability and trust.
\- Translate strategic goals into actionable plans for specific projects and operations.
\- Understand dependencies between roadmap projects, synchronize milestones, identify constraints and dive deep where necessary to unblock and deliver the roadmap.
\- Create new tools and business processes that simplify, standardize and enable operational excellence across the entire production value stream.
\- Develop and own operational rhythms for all of production operations teams
\- Identify potential risks in manufacturing processes and develop mitigation strategies and recovery plans.
Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
A day in the life
This role will be supporting production of satellite operations across our facilities in Redmond and Kirkland, WA. A typical day for this role will be working directly with production teams and value stream owners on plan execution and check process adherence. You will interact with various stakeholders including customers, suppliers, and internal teams.
About the team
Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low\-latency, high\-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world. To deliver these complex solutions, as the Senior Technical Program Manager you will partner with peers across all Kuiper teams, including hardware, software, supply chain, manufacturing, launch, facilities, finance, compliance, and HR.
  

* 5\+ years of project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management experience
* Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
* Experience defining KPI's/SLA's used to drive multi\-million dollar businesses and reporting to senior leadership

title: Finance Manager FP&A and Automation, Amazon Supply Chain Services (ASCS)
description:
\- 5\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- BA or BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, Computer Science) and 5\+ years of finance experience, or Master’s degree and 3\+ years of finance experience
  

Amazon Supply Chain Services (ASCS) is the umbrella name for Amazon’s suite of services that help businesses transport, warehouse, fulfill, deliver, and plan their movement of goods, inclusive of both on\- and off\-Amazon volume. With ASCS, businesses can offload their full supply chain planning \& execution or they can choose to integrate an à la carte menu of composable supply chain primitives into their existing processes. For many years, these services have been used by Amazon sellers as standalone solutions and have played a central role in improving the Amazon CX and reducing our CTS. In 2024, we began accelerating both the externalization of these services, so that merchants can use them for their off\-Amazon channels, as well as the interoperability of these services, which enables merchants to easily use more than one service at a time. Our three largest ASCS services that service off\-Amazon volume are Multi\-Channel Fulfillment (using inventory in Amazon’s fulfillment network to ship orders from non\-Amazon channels), Amazon Freight (bulk shipments from/to 1P and 3P warehouses) and Amazon Shipping (parcel shipments from/to 1P and 3P warehouses).
The ASCS FP\&A and Automation Finance Manager will own the consolidation of the financials for the 8 ASCS services. This role will partner with each service’s finance team and business leaders to build a single financial narrative for our ASCS business to be presented to STeam and BOD. This role will also partner with each service finance team and with other central finance teams (such as Ops Central Finance, Product teams and IPAT) to standardize and automate the 8 ASCS P\&Ls.
This leader will also own the automation roadmap for the Externalized Fulfillment services within ASCS (Multi\-channel fulfillment/MCF and Buy with Prime/BwP) with the objective of eliminating manual inputs. This leader will be the main MCF/BwP Finance POC to the Data Analytics team and define the data and reports required by Finance from this team.
We are looking for finance leaders who are passionate about building new businesses, FP\&A and automation.
Key job responsibilities
\- ASCS financials consolidation and reporting including quarterly guidance, monthly and quarterly business reviews, Steam and BOD.
\- Delivering on ASCS standardization and automation VP level goals.
\- Develop and deliver on the automation roadmap for MCF and BWP (Externalized Fulfillment).
\- Drive revenue, cost and controls improvement initiatives across ASCS businesses.
  

* 4\+ years of identifying, leading, and executing opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes experience
* MBA, or CPA
* Knowledge of SQL/ETL
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

title: Sr. Solutions Architect, Luxury Stores
description:
\- 8\+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data \& analytics) experience
\- 3\+ years of design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures experience
\- 10\+ years of IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries experience
\- Proven track record of managing complex technical integration projects
\- Strong understanding of API security, scalability, and integration patterns
\- Demonstrated ability to translate complex business requirements to technical solutions
  

Amazon Selling Partner API (SP\-API) is the next generation suite of API\-based automation functionality for Amazon's Selling Partners, evolving from the Amazon Marketplace Web Service (Amazon MWS) APIs. These APIs enable sellers to programmatically list, sell and exchange data on Amazon.
The Luxury Stores team is seeking an experienced and self\-motivated Sr. Solutions Architect who will shape the future of luxury retail on Amazon. As a trusted technical advisor, you will lead integration projects for luxury brands while working with internal cross\-functional partners (e.g., Business Development, Product, Marketing and Engineering) to drive innovation and adoption of API solutions.
The ideal candidate possesses a unique balance of technical depth and customer\-facing experience, with the ability to assess opportunities both within and beyond SP\-API implementations and drive adoption across organizations ranging from emerging brands to established enterprises. You will need to stay current with emerging technologies, industry trends, and competitive offerings to identify potential API gaps and opportunities that could enhance the luxury retail experience. You must be comfortable building and maintaining technical credibility with diverse stakeholders, from API Developers and Solution Architects to Product Managers and C\-level executives.
Success in this role requires the ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges while delivering measurable business value. You will investigate and evaluate solutions across various technical domains, including but not limited to APIs, cloud services, e\-commerce platforms, and retail technologies. You will thrive in ambiguity and define solutions that are extensible to broader contexts and use cases, while maintaining the high standards expected in the luxury retail space.
Key job responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
• Establish technical credibility in the sales cycle and collaborate with Sales to drive adoption of API solutions among luxury brands
• Lead technical projects to integrate luxury brand systems with Amazon's SP\-API platform, from discovery through implementation and post\-production support
• Design and architect scalable, secure solutions aligned with customers' long\-term business goals
• Build deep relationships with luxury brands' senior technical leaders
• Conduct training sessions and workshops for customers considering or using Selling Partner API
• Create code samples, tutorials, whitepapers, and technical articles for the developer community
• Author customer\-facing publications including onboarding guides and best practices documentation
• Participate in technical architectural discussions to optimize customer integrations
• Provide customer feedback to development teams and influence SP\-API roadmap
• Ensure API solutions comply with acceptable use policies and security standards
• Develop reference architectures specific to luxury retail implementations
• Act as a technical liaison between customers, support, engineering, and business teams
• Identify bottlenecks, suggest solutions, and drive improvements across teams
  

* 5\+ years of infrastructure architecture, database architecture and networking experience
* Knowledge of SAP systems (like SAP Business Suite, S/4HANA, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP HANA, SAP Business Objects, etc.) and their architecture and infrastructure needs
* Experience working with end user or developer communities

title: Software Development Manager, ALX SIERRA
description:
\- 3\+ years of engineering team management experience
\- 7\+ years of working directly within engineering teams experience
\- 3\+ years of designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- 8\+ years of leading the definition and development of multi tier web services experience
\- Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full software/hardware/networks development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, certification, and livesite operations
\- Experience partnering with product or program management teams
  

As an SDM in ALX SIERRA (Science, Insights, Experience, Research, Reporting \& Analytics), you'll lead a team of software engineers requiring partnership across frontend, backend, applied science, UX, and data engineering functions to integrate Generative AI and ML into Amazon Leadership Experience (ALX) products and processes.
You will define a roadmap that works backwards from our three year and operational plans, and as the leader of your team, you are responsible for establishing mechanisms to manage delivery and ensure quality of the software delivered by your team. You will hire, develop, and structure your team for harmony and efficiency, and you will support your team by establishing vision, managing tradeoffs, and setting expectations with stakeholders.
A day in the life
• Interview a candidate for a new role on the team
• Present a strategy document to your stakeholders to drive alignment on team roadmap
• Attend a team\-level operations review meeting to understand system health
• Review a design document produced by engineers on the team and provide feedback to ensure alignment with overall product strategy and stakeholder needs
• Hold 1:1s with members of the team to provide them with feedback, support, and context
• Meet with a customer to understand a problem they need your team to solve
• Escalate an issue to remove a blocker for the team
About the team
Amazon Leadership Experience (ALX) SIERRA (Science, Insights, Experience, Research, Reporting \& Analytics) is a horizontal, multi\-disciplinary organization whose mission is to be a force multiplier for the broader ALX organization and our key customer cohorts. We accomplish this by using our expertise in data analytics and science, economics, machine learning (ML), UX, I/O psychology, and engineering to build insights and experiences that raise the bar in understanding and shaping decision making at scale by integrating within and across talent journeys as well as through self\-service tools and closed loop mechanisms outside of those journeys. Our portfolio of products spans foundational data sources, metrics, and research through to finished features and products that our end\-customers interact with on a daily basis.
  

* Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior leadership to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy
* Experience in recruiting, hiring, mentoring/coaching and managing teams of Software Engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers

\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product

Are you passionate about innovation and helping customers daily? Are you a data\-driven product leader with experience launching disruptive software products?
Alexa AI team is developing innovative Generative\-AI solutions to make Alexa a trusted assistant that helps customers daily.
As Principal Product Manager Tech for the Alexa AI team you will:
Define and drive customer\-facing features for Alexa including advanced Conversational AI features with a high bar on responsible application of technology;
Create advanced features out of technical innovations
Drive clarity out of ambiguity, communicate a clear vision and align others to execute on your thoughtful requirements

title: Software Development Engineer, EC2 Seatbelt
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
  

Are you the type of person who enjoys solving complex problems in the cloud? Do you enjoy making an impact at a massive scale and keeping millions of customers' data safe in the cloud? Are you obsessed with designing software that efficiently works with large scale executions, and leveraging the technological breadth of AWS ? Do you want the adrenaline rush of protecting customers, and working with services in relation to detecting or implementing cloud protection? If this is you, then we have got an opportunity for you!
As a Software Engineer on the EC2 Seatbelt team, you will be developing new software systems and creating features for existing software systems. You will solve mission critical development and operations problems throughout the global presence for EC2\. You’d design and own robust systems with cloud scale best practices. You’d leverage deep experience of running a critical service with zero downtime, eliminating scalability bottlenecks and monitoring in every dimension.
You would enjoy working closely with a peer group of highly talented engineers, and in an environment that encourages innovation, calculated risk taking and rapid decision making.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee\-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work\-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life\-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship \& Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one\-on\-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better\-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future
Key job responsibilities
As a Software Engineer on the EC2 Seatbelt team, you will be building and enhancing software systems. You will solve mission critical development and operations problems throughout the global presence for EC2\. You’d design and own robust systems with cloud scale best practices. You’d leverage deep experience of running a critical service with zero downtime, eliminating scalability bottlenecks and monitoring in every dimension. You would enjoy working closely with a peer group of highly talented engineers, and in an environment that encourages innovation, calculated risk taking and rapid decision making.
About the team
The EC2 Seatbelt team develops and maintains secure infrastructure for ad\-hoc operations in EC2 at scale, prioritizing operator safety and controlled execution. Our platform enables operators to create, manage and execute scripts for LSE mitigation and operational issues when standard methods are ineffective. While offering flexibility, Seatbelt maintains strict approval processes and leadership visibility to ensure EC2's reliability and security.
  

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer, Aurora Storage
description:
\- 5\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 5\+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
\- 5\+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team
  

Are you interested in building hyper\-scale database services in the cloud? Do you want to revolutionize the way databases are built for the cloud ? Do you want to have direct and immediate impact on hundreds of thousands of users who use AWS database services?
Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and Postgres compatible, relational database service that combines the speed and availability of high\-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost\-effectiveness of open source databases. It provides up to five times better performance than MySQL at a price point one tenth that of a commercial database while delivering similar performance and availability. Amazon Aurora is powered by an auto\-scaling, auto\-healing, distributed storage cluster of massive world\-wide scale.
Amazon Aurora Storage team is looking for experienced software engineers who are excited about building large scale systems spanning tens of thousands of servers, across multiple data\-centers worldwide. These are core systems development positions where you will own the design and development of significant software components critical to our industry leading database services architected for the cloud.
In this hands on position you will be asked to do everything from building rock\-solid components to mentoring other engineers. You need to not only be a top software developer with a good track record of delivering, but also excel in communication, leadership and customer focus. This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast growing business and help shape the technology, product and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical and software expertise and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to deliver high quality code that has a broad business impact.
AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations — from foundational services such as Amazon’s Simple Storage Service (S3\) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2\), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS’s services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you’ll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS, including support for customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services
10031
Key job responsibilities
Our engineers collaborate across diverse teams, projects, and environments to have a firsthand impact on our global customer base. You’ll bring a passion for innovation, data, search, analytics, and distributed systems. You’ll also:
Solve challenging technical problems, often ones not solved before, at every layer of the stack.
Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative software solutions to transform service performance, durability, cost, and security.
Build high\-quality, highly available, always\-on products.
Research implementations that deliver the best possible experiences for customers.
A day in the life
As you design and code solutions to help our team drive efficiencies in software architecture, you’ll create metrics, implement automation and other improvements, and resolve the root cause of software defects. You’ll also:
Build high\-impact solutions to deliver to our large customer base.
Participate in design discussions, code review, and communicate with internal and external stakeholders.
Work cross\-functionally to help drive business decisions with your technical input.
Work in a startup\-like development environment, where you’re always working on the most important stuff.
About the team
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge\-sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one\-on\-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects that help our team members develop your engineering expertise so you feel empowered to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
About AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee\-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Work/Life Balance
We value work\-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
Mentorship \& Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge\-sharing, mentorship and other career\-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better\-rounded professional.
  

* 5\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Business Intel Engineer II, Amazon Grocery Logistics (AGL), Amazon Grocery Logistics (AGL)
description:
\- 3\+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
\- Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
\- Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
\- Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
\- Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
  

Amazon Grocery is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) who is passionate about data. Our team, seeks to develop solutions that increase the speed and quality of decision\-making through analytics, automation and reporting. In this role, you will drive Grocery Instock \& Shrink analytics and developing insight driven tooling.
To be successful in this role, you must have a high capacity to Learn and Be Curious adapting to the latest changes in the business, systems, tools, and techniques for extracting, processing, analyzing, modeling, and taking action on data. The ideal candidate will be a self\-starter, highly analytical, consistently think in terms of automation, and intensely detailed with a strong customer focus to drive strategy in a fast\-paced environment with limited supervision. The ideal candidate shows good judgment in making technical trade\-offs between short term and long\-term business needs and demonstrate the ability to drive issues to completion.
As a BIE on our team you will focus on exciting and challenging problems, including:
Apply your deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight from large and complicated data sets
Engage business stakeholders in constructive dialogues to convert business problems into logic problems that can be solved with data, statistics, and/or scripting
Design, develop, and implement scalable, automated infrastructure for data extraction, processing, computation, and delivery
Support fellow engineers and scientists to deliver analytical projects and build proof of concept applications
Work closely with data engineering, product management, and business stakeholders to deliver features to customers
Learn new technology and techniques such that you can meaningfully support product and process innovation
Help drive new initiatives and data integration projects
  

* Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
* Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large\-scale, complex datasets
